D-oTLjavN9s4rA_2WNBgTQ.text: The food was beyond delicious. You could tell everything was freshly made in house. The service was excellent and they were attentive to our needs. The owner/cook came out to make sure the meal was up to standards.

tyBLSPq4v4KkGTA6f2WIfA.text: Originally I had chosen to eat here because I wanted to try something new! Upon walking to the entrance, a piece of paper notified us that they do not have their liquor license and we can bring our own alcohol, if wanted.   We were greeted and seated almost right away, which was great.   I'm not sure if the lack of decor is because of budget but the walls are really bare & the color scheme does not match at all.   The menu looked and sounded very appetizing but I was slightly disappointed when I received my food. The biscuit was huge (no complaint there) but it was very dense. The gravy lacked flavor and the country fried steak was actually really good! Also, the Mango drink that had yogurt in it, was ok. I felt as if I stuck a straw in a tub of yogurt & started sipping.   Overall, I do not think I will be returning due to a misleading name and over priced mediocre food.

vWEH43iWfGWddDwdHL-jWA.text: just now I have been an avid customer of Mimosas since I moved here in August 2018. Made an order via Uber Eats this time. My order was not only incorrect but when I called I was told that's an Uber Eats issue and to call Uber but I can't get my money refunded and then the representative hung up on me. I'm 4 months pregnant and my order was specific to my dietary needs. I told them this by the way. When I called back I told them, I don't want a refund. I just want my order corrected. I even told them that if there will be an additional charge that I have no problem paying the difference. The owner told me "We don't have time to correct it or no send another Uber driver out because we're busy."   What I love about that response is they're never too busy to keep the benefit of my money although I can't eat my own meal. That's no excuse. So I drove down to Mimosas and demanded my order get corrected. They simply refired what was already cooked and hand my back my meal. To be honest, it looks like the food fed to pigs before slaughtered and the hasbrowns are cold; the staff near the kitchen had an attitude.    Sometimes your food can be good but if the treatment is bad its irrelevant. I definitely won't be back again! Vegas is too competitive especially in the food industry to tolerate sub par treatment.    I drove back home and made whatever breakfast I could in my pantry.

f-efngyPTA4gXJsxB5CrNg.text: My boyfriend and I were in the area yesterday and wanted to try something new. Since I bookmarked this place on Yelp a while back, we decided to come in here for brunch. I can strongly agree with the other Yelp reviews on here that this place did not disappoint. We were greeted by the nice hostess who seated us within minutes. Our waiter then came by immediately to introduce himself and took our drink order while we looked over the menu. Considering that it was our first time here, the menu was a bit overwhelming. There were so many choices of omelettes, benedicts, skillets, waffles, French toasts, pancakes, and other breakfast favorites you can imagine. My boyfriend decided on the corned beef skillet and I chose the fried chicken benedict. On the fried chicken benedict, you have the choice of either hollandaise or gravy. Since I wanted to try both, they were nice to offer both sauces and put them on the side. The food came out quick and hot. Everything was extremely delicious and flavorful. I really liked the gravy with the fried chicken benedict. We were also surprised that the portions are humongous! We both ended up getting to-go boxes because we were just so stuffed. In addition, our waiter was very nice and attentive with checking on us frequently and refilling our drinks.   Overall, this is a great brunch spot for good food and excellent service. Although this place is known for their mimosas, we didn't try it at this visit. It'll definitely give us a reason to come back. We we will be back for sure.

szjg7ieti9hRVpv7VwzjmQ.text: We were seated pretty quickly for a busy Sunday late morning    They got our drink orders right away and the peach mimosa was very tasty.   The problem came when they brought our order out, one plate at a time...who does that?!   It took 15 minutes from the first plate of pancakes (which were a side replacement for my toast) until the last plate at our table, my egg white omelet.   Here's problems  2 & 3,  they delivered the wrong burger and my omelette was not egg whites only (which they charge an extra 1.25 for)   My husband ate his burger because he didn't want to wait for the correct one and I did the same with my omelette    The food was good overall, but 2 wrong orders on a table of 4 is unacceptable and serving them one at a time is silly.   They need to fix their service because it could be an awesome spot.

1-gRoI-3bA-8uMN0YEY2Eg.text: Items Ordered: Guava Mimosa Churro Waffle - Cinnamon, Powdered Sugar, Cajeta Caramel, Vanilla Bean Ice Cream Nutella S'mores French Toast - Graham Cracker Crusted French Toast, Marshmallows, Nutella, Whipped Cream and Powdered Sugar Bacon Chicken Waffle - Bacon Bits in the Batter, House Fried Chicken, Honey Drizzle Buttermilk Biscuit  An expansion from its 2016 debut in San Jose California, Mimosas Gourmet recently opened at 3455 South Durango Drive, the location directly next to well-regarded  La Maison de Maggie Crepe Shop breathing life into a dilapidated strip mall near the Desert Breeze Soccer Complex on the corner of Spring Mountain.  Replacing a former restaurant and open now for just over a few weeks, Mimosas Gourmet offers diners a collection of their eponymous beverage in a wide range of shapes and sizes, the bill of fare itself quite sizable while the 2,500 square foot space features relatively typical seating options, the stero overhead playing IHeartRadio at a fairly loud volume, though not loud enough that conversation is impaired.  Sharing one $8.50 Guava Mimosa, a $3.99 Biscuit and a trio of the restaurant's more interesting plates, it was in piecemeal fashion as dishes were prepared that items were sent forth from the kitchen, the bubbly beverage far more bitter than those many in Sin City with sliced Strawberries and Oranges on top for a touch of visual flare.  Receiving the Churro Waffle and one mistaken plate first, the order re-confirmed and very obviously resubmitted to the kitchen given the delivery times to follow, the team could go a long way by promoting this item as a 'signature' with both the interior and top of the dough featuring a generous amount of Cinnamon and Sugar, the faux-Maple Syrup not a personal favorite but really not so bad when paired with a globe of Vanilla Ice Cream that slowly melts and melds the flavors.  Maroon 5 followed by Bruno Mars, the crowd a wide range of ages and ethnicities, it was after some delay that the Bacon-studded Waffle topped with crisp Chicken Fingers arrived with Honey already added, both items well prepared if not particularly memorable while the overpriced biscuit was fluffy and delicious despite being more like a jumbo dinner roll than something with proper buttery layers.  Serving large portions, the biggest and richest yet to come, it was another ten minutes before the three-piece tower of French Toast landed to the right of un-cleared plates and empty Water glasses, this diabolical concoction seeing melted Marshmallow Fluff and at least a tablespoon of Nutella at top, middle and bottom, the Cinnamon and Ginger not entirely lost either thought the center piece of toast was so overly saturated with toppings that it almost ate like Custard.     *** Not exactly "locally owned," but nonetheless doing some interesting spins on Breakfast and Lunch classics in a space that is comfortable and easily accessible to those in Spring Valley or Summerlin, Mimosas Gourmet joins an ever-growing list of places to consider for breakfast when tired of the same ol' same ol' and for those unwilling to go looking for better in the Southeast or on the Strip.

J9WcxOh1ttKoJgoSoFHHiQ.text: So first time here, we went around 12:30 on a Sunday and I thought for sure there would be a wait but we got lucky and there wasn't.   It's awesome outside they had a little coffee area that said enjoy complimentary coffee while you wait, that was a cute touch I have never seen before.  We were seated and drink order was taken right away. Then about 15 minutes later our food order was taken. There isn't anything for the kiddos to do while you wait so bring something to keep them entertained.  The food took awhile to cook but that's ok, however in a really busy day I can imagine it would be longer.  Food was amazing. Had the steak, avocado sandwich with caramelized onions and fries. Their fries are the best.   Kids meal portions are huge. Daughter had pancakes , with the eggs and bacon. Their pancakes are the bomb.  Husband had skirt steak and eggs and potatoes. Skirt steak was over cooked and a bit rough, toast is also over cooked but potatoes were amazing.  Service and people are nice, birthdays here are nice. The mimosas are mediocre. But will definitely be coming here again.

zmZjgKl57nEMBcvQrLFhAg.text: Upon entering we were warming greeted and advised to sit anywhere. We chose a comfortable booth. Our refreshment order was immediately taken. The breakfast menu has a wide variety of choices. Our two selections were the short stack of pancakes (2 per order) with a side order of bacon and the Chili Verde with two eggs over easy and hash browns. The Chili Verde breakfast comes with three corn tortillas, refried beans, choice of eggs, choice of potatoes, and choice of toasted bread. The pancakes were very large and had a nice hint of vanilla. The bacon was over cooked, hard to cut and was returned to the kitchen. The pork in the Chili Verde was fork tender and tasty with the green salsa. The two eggs were perfectly cooked. I would have preferred a thicker sauce for the refried beans. Hash browns were nice and crispy but way too much for one person. I passed on the toast.   On this day we choose Mimosas Gourmet because it was convenient  to the places we were going. Since it is not in our neighborhood I would not drive the distance to specifically eat there.

kr88T44PKkAaH1pECApJkg.text: I really wanted to give a higher rating, but this place simply isn't named Pancakes Gourmet.  Mimosas Gourmet is a brunch restaurant that's located clear across town from me. Although I normally wouldn't have to venture beyond Henderson for this type of food, I was meeting up with some friends and they seem to favor this side of town in general.  This spot is next door to La Maison de Maggie, which I'd tried last year, so I knew where I was going. In case you're not as familiar with this plaza on Durango between Spring Mountain and Desert Inn, look for Dunkin Donuts and Arby's and take one of the small side streets, preferably on the Arby's side.  The place was completely packed when I arrived, and fortunately our group was already seated. It did take a while to get to order, but they seemed to prep the food quickly enough once that happened. I won't knock them for any slowness.  However, I didn't really like two of the dishes which I'd tried. The star protein of the Fried Chicken Benedict ($13.50) was boring and dry, not the juicy meat with crispy batter which you'd expect. To add insult to injury, the biscuits (a twist, replacing the standard English muffin) weren't really rich or flaky. Using the Pepper Plant pepper sauce made it a little better, thanks to the savory spices and the moderate kick of heat, but it wasn't enough. The side of country potatoes was pretty enjoyable at least, but not quite addictive.  I also found little to write home about in the Bananas Foster French Toast ($11.95). The caramelized bananas were nice, but I think the heaps of whipped cream weren't enough to cover up boring, overly chewy French toast that was rather bland other than the cinnamon flavor.  What I'd possibly drive back for are the pancakes. Despite my massive food coma afterward, I don't regret going for the carbs. I ordered the Banana Walnut Pancakes ($9.50), which were fluffy and buttery and held up even as leftovers a few hours later. The banana was incorporated into the batter, and the crunchy walnuts were the perfect complement in flavor and texture. You almost don't need the syrup with these pancakes. And lest you think I'm cutting back, I had to get a to-go box because those pancakes are quite literally as big as my head.  Expect huge portions at Mimosas Gourmet, but stick to the pancakes and perhaps look into some of the foods which I didn't try. I'd avoid the French Toast menu, but maybe I was simply unlucky enough to run into the lone dud of the Eggs Benedict selections.

zcMojyUNKY_MbUpRNiPR3A.text: Needed a breakfast spot and all the usuals that came to mind are always super crowded. So I used yelp and found this place. We walked in and there were plenty of seats and he instantly gave us a nice booth. The menu is filled with a lot of scrumptious looking items and it definitely had a southwest flare to it. And let's not Forget to mention there were a lot of alcoholic beverages to choose from. They have a full bar. The mimosas look to be mixed with wine not champagne. I'll have to try it on The next visit.   Happy to see chilaquiles on the menu I'll try that next time. I ordered a Mexican skillet and my daughter ordered an omelette and added steak. We ordered a chocolate chip pancake to share.   Omg the food was sooo good. The steak in the Mexican skillet with the mushrooms...yummy. My daughter said hers was good but I think she liked my steak better they must have used a different meat and they didn't put much in it. We did have to pick apart her omlette and search to see if it was just a mistake. But we found a couple of pieces. So I wouldn't recommend the add on steam unless you're specific about the steak etc.   The waiter was concerned we didn't like the food because we had quite A bit left and we didn't want a doggy bag. e9mWNYno_Mse3IQ9M7-Z1w.text: The reason this place gets one star is because THEY DON'T HAVE MIMOSAS! Upon sitting down and looking at the menu they have taped a notice over the mimosa portion of their menu saying they don't have a permit to sell mimosas. I don't know how long they have been open, or if they once had them, but they lose all integrity if they don't have the item they are named for.   The reason this place could get two stars is because their food is decent. I tried their biscuits and gravy. They weren't my favorite because they were spicy and had a southwest taste to them, rather than your traditional home-style biscuits and gravy. I did not like that, but I could see other people liking that. I also tried their eggs benedict and their country potatoes. The eggs benedict was unremarkable. Their country potatoes, like the biscuits and gravy, were a little spicy and more southwestern, made with bell peppers and onions. I'm not opposed to this, but it should have been described in the menu better, as that was not the style I expected. I also did not care much for their coffee. I will say that their pancakes were amazing! Even though they were huge, they didn't have the too much like cake feel, and had a perfect crisp to the outside and the perfect consistency on the inside. Maybe the food would have tasted better with a mimosa? I'll never know.    The reason this place doesn't get anymore stars is because the ambiance wasn't amazing. The decor is sunflower yellow colored walls with mediocre paintings of flowers. The service was good and the servers were nice, but nothing that stands out.  There was no line, and I went during weekend prime-time breakfast hours. It is a smaller sized restaurant, but has tables to accommodate larger parties.   But guys, there are NO MIMOSAS!

mYhc4JJPtqyv0YXSfRKP7g.text: This place is delicious! The mimosas are delish. You can get almost any combination of mimosa. Additionally, you can get a gigantic (and I mean GIGANTIC) mimosa! It's awesome. The food is great too. This place actually cooked my bacon the way I like it - crispy! Yum. The eggs I ordered were actually real eggs and not the pre-mixed stuff that other places used.  The use of real eggs is a huge plus in my book. I had the waffle combo - it comes with eggs, bacon or sausage and a waffle. This place is pretty much on par with other breakfast food places with regard to price. I'm definitely going back to get the huge mimosa. It's a small restaurant but it appears to have a strong following in the community. This is a nice little place tucked away in the corner of a strip mall. Perfect for breakfast with friends and family.

1ufDpWqipwStuWJF6acbyQ.text: What a wonderful experience. I went with a couple of girlfriends for brunch. The place was packed and the mimosas on every table looked delicious. We opted for no mimosas because we were driving but had an incredible meal. The staff was amazing. I was deciding between the crab Benedict and the churro waffle and told our server about my conundrum. I decided on the Benedict and the next thing I know she's bringing out the churro waffle for our table to share, on the house. Everyone was so friendly and the food was good. We'll definitely be back.

1E-vp59S55699iGsahjf9w.text: For me it is just like any other breakfast place. Although the serving here is humongous! 3 people can share a plate of anything. We had to take a box for the doggie :). They don't serve mimosa yet as they are still waiting for their liquor license.

FVN_STnjZfVoDo7bSfiEag.text: As promised, we tried them out again this morning. I ordered the fried chicken benedict & hunny got a supreme omelette. HOLY SMOKES! Start with his omelette - perfectly cooked meat, oozing with cheese, eggs were fluffy - so much yum!  Now, the fried chicken benedict - I ordered it with country gravy instead of hollandaise sauce, so it was - 2 biscuits, fried chicken (tenders maybe - breast pieces) topped with cheese, 2 slices of super thick bacon & all covered with gravy. The cheese melted into the bacon and OH MY GOSH heavenly!!! The gravy wasn't too salty, the chicken and as tender & had a crisp outside. The biscuit was fluffy and OH so good! I loved this dish!   The potatoes weren't my fav, but our kids will rat them so they won't go to waste:) staff is still super friendly & hunny tipped very well because I was so super happy with the flavors. We might have to bring the kids next time so we can try some pancakes & waffles!   *****************  Nice atmosphere, friendly waitress.  First time here - the menu is extensive! Lots of diversity and selection. Nice variety of mimosas too.   We ordered corned beef hash with over medium eggs & hash browns and a meat lovers scramble skillet. Unfortunately, our meal came out incorrect with scrambled eggs instead of over medium. The home made corned beef hash had a ton of potatoes in comparison to the amount of beef in the dish. Standard hash browns. Hunny enjoyed his meat lovers skillet but would have enjoyed more without the sour cream drizzle. Again, lots of potatoes in comparison to the meat.   Our waitress was very nice. Apologetic when we pointed out the error. The meal hadn't been touched, so they took it off our bill without any questions. We will try again another day.

Rlks4RjpMAdhxP_FlSrVXg.text: I love Mimosas Gourmet!! They have a TON of yummy flavored mimosas and they're SO good! They're known for having gigantic mimosas to share although, I haven't tried that yet. Their waffles are great as well as omelets. I did not care for the country fried steak & eggs. Amazing service by all servers! I'd highly recommend for large portioned breakfast, strong drinks, and REALLY good music vibes!

hA-WJ0hnhBTAMbHRkeBI9A.text: Great food. Had prickly pear mimosa and hubby had Michelada both can in frozen mugs , so awesome! Had pancake combo ,so huge with eggs and ham. The chili verde was tender and tasty. Definitely will return.  Unfortunately we live by Aliante, but is worth the drive. Also the service was fast and friendly!

RV5CLlkmwe6fGPWP_cX_yw.text: Great spot for mimosas! Food was on point too I ordered the chiliquilles and watermelon mimosas both were great. A little over crowded with no room for a waiting area so people will gather by your table if your seated up front which can be annoying but the service was exceptional and I would def go back.

96_eHAzgTgHmA55hjXg7rA.text: Wait, whattttt. I didn't write a review of this place? How is that possible?! Mimosas Gourmet is about 15 minutes from the strip but worth the venture if you like delicious food and the most original mimosas on the planet. Also, if you're down to drink an entire bottle of champagne in the form of a mimosa, that's an option! No juicy juice here, ladies and gents. The giant mimosa *will* get you sauced.  My husband and I ordered one with guava and pineapple and it was ah-ma-zing. We also ordered breakfasts foods (I can't recall precisely what it was and you shouldn't blame me) and they were tasty, huge portions. Don't hesitate to come here and have a ginormous mimosa. Do it for the 'gram! You won't regret it.  (Sidenote: Please share. A giant one for a single person is probably conducive to alcohol poisoning and nobody wants that). Cheers!

VpdgAcZTCgETX-T-npYStQ.text: Small intimate environment with amazing food. It was a little hot inside but other than that... WONDERFUL!!

VP9sbWBnYCUOTwjJbkx3Fw.text: I went to Mimosas Gourmet on a busy Saturday morning with my husband. We were seated right away and our drink order was noted and brought out right away. I ordered a guava mimosa. It was a generous serving size and it was pretty strong! My husband ordered the Irish coffee and a regular coffee. They did not charge him for his regular  coffee!  I ordered the diablo skillet with the jalapenos on the side. I enjoyed it! However, I don't know if I would call it a "skillet". My husband had the chorizo scramble and said it was tasty but a bit dry. I think it came with salsa and they just forgot to bring it out. We shared an order of French toast and it was ok. I wouldn't necessarily order it again. Big portions sizes. I took half of my skillet home.  Service was fast and the staff were nice and welcoming. I will definitely be returning and trying out other mimosa flavors!

HJCYXZhCBKJOlB4iRb_tYg.text: On a whim with a severe craving for breakfast I happened upon this delectable place. I came in with my best friend. We were greeted by friendly staff and vibrant decor. After looking over the expansive menu she decided upon the Chile verde omelet with a pancake side and I chose the huveos rancheros. We waited for about 15 minutes for them to bring us our food. Oh boy..... let me tell you when they brought out our selections.... we were in foodie heaven. Everything was cooked to perfection!!!   The omelet was full of flavor, had amazing texture, and the pork melted in your mouth. The huveos rancheros was to die for you could tell everything was homemade and seasoned just right. The portions were humongous! I didn't think I could eat the entire thing.......... well here I am with a bowl full of jelly. Haha but seriously my belly is so full. I couldn't help my self.   Did I mention that we forgot about the pancake because our meals were so good? We ate our entire meals, and then had to give that puppy a try. The pancake was heaven on earth. It tasted like a funnel cake in pancake form, but better. I didn't think I had any more room left to eat it. However, it was so light and fluffy that the whole pancake got eaten between the two of us.   I love this spot. Eat here if you want to enjoy your experience through and through. Please don't let the strip mall deter you. It almost stopped us..... but it was well worth it!

IPJih3ax20y0Ivh9XTfaYg.text: Upon locating this restaurant, "Gourmet" was definitely not the word that came to mind when I saw the exterior of the restaurant. The parking lot was pretty empty and it didn't help that the windows were plastered with cheesy menu photos all over. Like other reviewers, I almost considered trying the French cafe next door since pastries are always a great idea!  When we walked in, we were immediately greeted by two friendly servers. The vibe is homey and cozy. It is definitely a locals joint.  I ordered the Herb Chicken skillet which consists of homemade country potatoes, herb chicken (obv), jack cheese, onions, garlic and asparagus. The platter was HUGE. If you have ever been to Hash a Go Go, the serving size is pretty similar. The meal came accompanied with a homemade biscuit. I rate this meal 5/5 since everything was delightful. The potatoes had great seasoning and were nice and crispy. The chicken was juicy and well prepared and the biscuit was one of the best I have ever had.  Our servers did not miss a beat when it came to refilling our water glasses and checking on our table. They were jolly and super friendly.   The reason I am not giving this place 5 stars is due to the water tasting funky. However, the mimosa made up for it! I will be returning, it was worth the drive and money

XV86_qJoTUloILCfa78l8A.text: My husband and I joined friends for brunch at Mimosas recently and loved our brunch. The mimosas were plenty strong too. Christie L. made a good pick on this one.  The menu offers plenty to choose from for brunch, almost too much! They offer scrambles, waffles, salads, benedicts, French Toast, omelets, pancakes, sandwiches, specialty entrees like huevos rancheros, burgers, and skillets. Even the mimosas are offered in about a dozen different flavors. Don't worry if mimosas aren't your thing because they have other drinks like Bloody Mary's too.   We started with mimosas that were strong. They were served in a large round glass and had a nice flavor. The mimosas were a bit different than traditional mimosas, but still good. The flavor was similar to a sparkling soda.   My husband and I shared three dishes, all were great! My husband ordered a sandwich that was tasty, but the homemade fries were the highlight. The Crab, Prawn, and Avocado Benedict was large and delicious. Everything on this dish was perfectly prepared and I loved the side of crispy hashbrowns. As much as we enjoyed these dishes the highlight of brunch had to be the Churro Waffles. These were amazing with such a great flavor. Just to add to the decadence the waffle was served with an entire scoop of ice cream on top.  The service was quick and attentive. Even in a group the service didn't miss a beat. Our food came to the table without much of a wait. We didn't have any issues with getting separate checks at the end.

cgedZl9acmocmOkm6jY5zQ.text: The wife and I's first time here.  The atmosphere is chill and casual.   Food is on point. I had the fajita steak benedict, and my wife had the California benedict. Perfectly seasoned and the portions are HUGE  For dessert we had the Churro waffle. This is a very sweet dish, as well as a perfect fit that will definitely feed at least 2 people.  The service was also perfect. Attentive and pays attention to details, my wife has a shelfish allergy and they were more than accommodating to cooking with fresh utensils that did not previously touch their seafood dishes.  All in all, highly recommended!  Pro Tip: We came during the week, and it was not busy at all. But the server said that their peak times are Friday-Sunday between 10am and 1pm  Happy Eating

MuOZJ3U8ntKiw2p6Zj3ayA.text: Service fantastic! Everyone was so attentive. Our server was so kind and thoughtful. Although I'm not opposed to this, it's definitely not five star material.   Onto the food... Tasty! Inexpensive! And served in a timely manner, I have nothing bad to say about this place. Corned beef hash that my girlfriend received was stellar corned beef and my pancakes were amazing (still did not surpass my favorite pancake & that is my breakfast of choice).   Again, thank you to the entire team for delivering an overall great experience that sent me into a food coma for the rest of the day.

MQFfhvCCHAFTa3m9jg6htA.text: First time here and already having a bad experience. Heard a lot of good things about this place but how they handled our party was ridiculous. They quoted us it would be an 30 min to an hour wait and that was fine with us, but as soon it hit almost two hours and seeing many parties pass us even with big parties it made us wonder if we were skipped. I get that the business is busy, but at least communicate with us that we are coming up. If we didn't communicate with the host, we probably wouldn't have gotten seated. Almost 60+ people got sat before us and there was no communication amongst them about our party.  Typing this is super disappointing because I've heard great things about this place, but after waiting for so long, the experience is ruined and to top it all off it was hot inside the business. AC wasn't on and they kept the door open, we then again had to tell the host and a waitress to turn on the AC for everyone and they finally did after arguing with them. Never coming back here. Really poor customer service.

p5IP4t1o-x0PLnrm6ftmTw.text: This is an Excellent place I love going there. I am from California and I love coming to this place. It's fun and I feel very welcome.  The Staff is great they make u feel very welcome and like family. The food is great and prices are great.

kJGCeXzWsauENDu1JJCMAA.text: So as I went to the bakery I noticed this place. MIMOSAS GOURMET.. so the thought of traditional French brunch thoughts were dancing in my head, opened the door and NOPE! It was basically a feel of American/French and heavy handed Mexican cafe but put on cool plates and presented a little nicer. The staff had that I just Rolled out of bed feel , made me feel comfort as we shared that much in common. Very friendly by the way. Allot of Spanish speaking across the room from kitchen to staff and Spanish commercials in between songs made me feel like I was back home in California.. love it!   Best chile verde I've had in a long time. This will be my New favorite Mexican Breakfast Spot. Pfft and the whole time I was looking for a place with salmon,pinched egg covered in beurre Blanc with a glass of fufi champagne lol This place is Solid GOLD!

photos.caption: Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile verde (Dope AF)

8HlXpF6WGZdgebh4sUmwKw.text: A mimosa place that can't actually sell mimosas. I know that they are working on their liquor license, but it's odd. You can bring your own bottle of champagne,  and I did on my return visit. They looked genuinely excited that I brought my own and immediately grabbed an extra pitcher and filled it with ice and water to keep it cold. They charged the 2 of us for 1 juice even though we got 2 different flavors to make our mimosas with.   As for the food, everything has been solid.  -Nutella pancakes: There is an absurd about of Nutella on there to me a non-Nutella lover, but I can see how someone would love it. But my boyfriend said that he wished it didn't have marshmallows.   -Corned beef hash: My favorite so far! I love the horseradish sauce on it and the insanely large biscuit.  -Gorgonzola scramble: I love gorgonzola, so this was a no brainer selection, but it wasn't enough food to me. -Bacon waffles: They actually crushed bacon and put in the batter. Bacon in every bite! -Brunch burger: Pretty solid. Also very large.  -Fried chicken benedict: Very large biscuit with above average gravy with rosemary.   Most meals here can easily be split. And they serve breakfast til 4 on the weekends!   My favorite memory is going there close to close and hearing a song by Mystikal that was not sensored. We were crying laughing as was the table behind us. Don't worry parents this has never happened again, but I'm kinda disappointed that I have not witnessed another slip.

xTF8Z2gZEnBVx_oz1YaC4g.text: I absolutely love this restaurant!  FOOD: Let's just start by saying TRY ONE OF THEIR EGGS BENEDICT! They have so many different options for eggs benedict and it is so good! Their menu has a lot of unique dishes that I have never seen anywhere else. Orders are large and all very delicious. Their hash browns are made so well, I like to ask for mine extra crispy. The Croissant Sandwich is really good and different, it's croissant with broccoli, cheese, ham, eggs, and hollandaise sauce.  DRINK: Coffee is served in a cute large mug. Cold drinks are served in mason jars. They are not serving their mimosas yet but based on the variety of mimosas on their menu, I know it's going to be great. Can't wait to try their lychee mimosa and their guava mimosa!  ATMOSPHERE: Small little restaurant with not much going on. Just a simple breakfast shop. The waiter was nice.

HO3yYy2YaCjPjacC0qbDqw.text: We had a wonderful brunch with Harvey as our server. The drinks were amazing, I had the lychee mimosa. The staff was so friendly and made some great food suggestions. I would highly recommend the pancakes-life changing. I only had 1 and couldn't finish it. They are so light, buttery and fluffy.

This place is simply amazing, food portions are large and the customer service is amazing! We were helped by Lermin & Alex who made our experience worth it! We will definitely be back next week!

I had breakfast at the bar this morning and chatted it up with the very friendly and hard working owner. She was so nice to me! I'll be back constantly.

48rPK36zCpuelMK_bHFJMg.text: Came here with my wife before leaving town. It's very popular so it was very crowded. The wait wasn't to bad and bar seating is first come first served. The food was good and a big portion. My wife loved her food. The only downside for me was that I asked for crispy bacon and over medium eggs but still got poached eggs and bacon that wasn't crispy. Other than that it was great and service was great. I would come here again and eat. The staff is great.

k70WKly7rXdWkoutRI0LZg.text: Just discovered this hidden gem today! We absolutely enjoyed our visit. Our server, Alex, was AWESOME. He made sure all our drinks were refilled, made sure we were doing fine. The chef came out and greeted us and asked us how the food was as well. Talk about customer service! BY THE WAY, the portions are huge! If dining with a group, I highly suggest sharing the dishes so you can try more of their menu out.   We ordered the short stack pancake, which was so big, we had enough for lunch. The flavor was nutty, buttery, the texture, fluffy and soft...just perfect. I ordered the smoked salmon eggs benedict, which tasted HEAVENLY...you can easily pass this place as it is tucked away in a plaza on Durango.   If you're planning to eat at Hash House, might I suggest you ditch that place and head out to Mimosa's? You'll thank me later.

_SUKKxeWqzSk3V2gx0yHjA.text: We found this place on yelp while visiting Vegas. So glad we did. Food was great, big menu and the mimosas were amazing! I don't know what they put in them, but trust me; you only need one!

wDAx5DQN_j0EBYoa9kVR1g.text: Off the strip brunch place. It is delicious and the people working there are great.   We had the chorizo eggs Benedicts--- very good.   Their watermelon mimosas, made from scratch, are delicious and not very sweet. Orange mimosas, made from scratch orange juice is also a great drink.   They have great variety of eggs Benedict, french toast and waffles--- in addition to the regular brunch items.   We also tried the banana Foster's french toast.   Escape the strip and have brunch here

-c0bBXyNF1qYZsF_H7CWBg.text: my wife and I went yesterday to check out this place for brunch because we Yelped brunch ideas and they had great reviews and was open till 4pm for brunch. the place was packed and the super mimosa's where huge and most tables where sharing one which I thought was cool and ingenious at the same time.  [Edited] I had the corn beef hash over country fried potatoes. looking at the picture (again) and reading what was in it I was expecting a delicious meal. If it wasn't for the awesome customer service from our waiter Jose and my wife having and excellent meal I would of gave this place a 1 star. BTW my wife gave them a 5 star on yelp. My wife and I agreed my pork was very bland and I hardly had much pork as it was. I had basically a skillet of potatoes my side of pancake was very good but for what I paid I was disappointed to basically only have a skillet of potatoes. It was around 3pm and maybe they where running low on corn beef hash but I would of picked something else over mostly potatoes.  My wife will probable convince me to go back and if I do I will update my yelp review. but a cool place, very noisy and a little cramped but an experience worth trying because of the super mimosa and our waiter Jose.

F3pvE3s9pQBS0LyrO-6ymQ.text: If you're craving for a good mimosa, this is the place to go! They have a list of different flavor juices and the lovely server told us we can mix the juices if we like for no extra fee. I decided to try mango and pineapple while my friend got guava and strawberry. I don't know how much champagne they put into it but let me tell ya, I was feeling a little buzzed, so no complaints there! For the food I decided to try the crab, prawn, and avocado benedict while my friend got the smoked salmon skillet. We both got the side of homemade potatoes. I thought the potatoes were okay. It was seasoned nicely but I do prefer my potatoes to be a bit more on the crispy side. The benedict I got was delicious! It had nice amount of crab, prawn, and avocado. The hollandaise sauce was smooth and completed the dish well. I didn't get to taste my friend's dish bur she did enjoy it. The dish is big though and she had to box the rest home. Later the server told us this dish is the biggest meal they have so if you want to get your money's worth, the smoked salmon skillet is the way to go!

8OnfWBjmloBisO3rVI7yJA.text: This is a great spot tucked away a bit off the strip but worth the drive! Instead of going for the super mimosa (which was very tempting), my sister and I decided to try a few of the regular size mimosas. I went with passionfruit the first round and guava the next. My sister started with cranberry and tried prickly pear next. SO good. The atmosphere was very chill and welcoming. Wasn't crowded and service was timely. We both decided to go for the Denver Omelette. (Or what we Easterners call Western Omelette). We also shared a classic waffle. The omelettes were amazing and so cheesy!! Definitely plan to visit here again next time we are in town!

7LW5wc_s1U4wLfeQG7rsaA.text: Wow! Being in the service industry I tend to sometimes be critical, although I TRY to be open minded. From start to finish everything was FANTASTIC! Started with Tito's Bloody Mary $8.50 add $1.00 for bacon, I didn't need the bacon. Sister had Mimosa with Lychee $8.50, 12 flavors total! Or share Mimosa w friend/ loved one/ partner/ etc/ for $34.99 I had the California omelet, bacon, mushrooms, green onions, tomatoes, jack and cheddar cheese, topped with avocado and sour cream. $12.50 Sister had Berry Berry French Toast Blackberries, Strawberries, & Blueberries with whipped cream and raspberry sauce. $11.95. Everyone works together as as team here to make sure everyone is happy. If you haven't tried Mimosa Cafe, what are you waiting for? Check it out for yourself, you'll be glad you did!

yCGKMkbXNdGOXQC1-UMjCQ.text: I really want to love this place! I will say that the food is surprisingly good, I have never had corned beef taste so good anywhere except my own Mother's! The only two complaints I will say, is that they do not currently have a liquor license, so the mimosas that are advertised are not available. Second being that it seems like the restaurant is a work in progress. It seems that there are a few decor pieces missing from the walls, and it's a little dark in certain areas of the restaurant. I definitely think this place has a lot of potential and did see quite a few UberEATS deliveries being picked up too. Will give a new rating when we can finally try a mimosa.

yK0kTbCo36LHk4Mf32jWBw.text: First time at mimosas. Service was great. Very friendly and the waitress kept calling me mija just like my grandma did when I was a kid!! I got the veggie skillet with a big ol biscuit.  Portions were large and food was great!! I'd definitely go back.

4dJF9n4gSyJ2aBztm2V6jQ.text: We loved this place initially, even took friends but last visit was so bad we won't return. Misunderstandings occur but this was pretty bad. We ordered 2 standard breakfasts:  2 eggs with country potatoes and side of toast.  We opted to upgrade to a bagel and I told waitress we'd split the bagel.  The order arrived and seemed skimpy..but we just thought it was the cook that day.  I decided to go ahead and get the English muffin that came w meal and asked another waiter to bring it.  Bill arrived and we were charged for the English muffin so I questioned it because waitress had said it came w mesl. At that point we didn't know waitress had misunderstood and split our entire breakfast.  So the mgr came over and started arguing with us saying we weren't entitled to another order of bread free.  It was baffling. Then she got mad and voided the charge for the whole meal.  We were still trying to figure out what she was talking about and why she was angry when the waitress said "you don't get two breads when you split a meal".  Case solved.  She split our entire breakfast.  On top of the meal being skimpy dye to her misunderstanding, the potatoes were cold as they left them sitting up on the pick up shelf while cook made the eggs..ridiculous and we got our breads after the meal.  It was all pretty bad.  From the loud blasting rap music to an argumentative mgr to a waitress that doesn't comprehend English.  It left us with a bad taste in more than one way.

qf9V0Wk9roGhfTVwP0SprQ.text: Food was D'lish!!! Mimosas on point. Music Playlist was . Southern Scramble, and pancake was sooo good! Wife got the Cali Benedict. Will definitely come back here.

B_lCDYhdJhxS-nACjj6cWg.text: Let me start by saying the food okay and drinks as well. Wait time and servers as well. So it's shocking for me to leave a bad review but I have no choice to do so. We went here for the first time on Sunday and we ordered the big mimosas drink. At first sip we all tasted bleach which was weird so we asked the server why is there bleach in our drink his response it's the straws. They are sanitized in bleached and rinsed to be reused. I was completely shocked as to why they would bleach straws instead of giving new straws. Well come Monday night I got sore throat and Tuesday morning my tonsils were swollen along with high fever of 102-103. I finally got time to go to Urgent Care and I was told I might have mono or strep. I am currently on medication but still in a lot of pain. Please be hygienic and clean the straws the right way or give us new straws. Keep in mind I don't eat out much and mostly eat at home. For me to get sick is very rare. I won't be coming back to this place again. Just for their hygienic reasons.

_02KcAqtgNIgG9uTB9VAAQ.text: Come hungry! I've been to Mismosa Gourmet 2 times in the last week. The first time was a weekday and the second was a weekend midmorning, the service was great both times. The food is delicious and plentiful. The mismosas are amazing. So of course I had to come back and bring a friend. The French toast is amazing and the fried chicken Benedict is my friends favorite! This place is definitely worth it.

_BHvpvc7ai54E1J8XrP-2Q.text: Hands down the best breakfast ever!  We had the diablo skillet and of course mimosas!!  The service and food were amazing and we will definitely be back!!

EE-ObBgjRCPSJWpSwozQHw.text: Got the Diablo Skillet and the Fried Chicken Benedict. Both were HUGE portions and tasted amazing! This place has great friendly staff too! Will be returning to try the chilaquiles (:

AlIsW8NIiV1zke17wPRaGA.text: It was okay. I probably won't be back it was fairly pricey for breakfast that was just okay. Service was fine but not great.

ryonLQjZBtoBgW-pSDd_tg.text: Came here about a month ago on a Sunday for breakfast. There was no wait, which was awesome since majority of the surrounding restaurants are super busy during this time. Ordered a 2 egg breakfast which was really good. The hot sauce they have on the tables made the meal even better! We ordered delivery for breakfast yesterday and unfortunately it was not as good as the first time. I had an omelet and it was a little soggy by arrival time. Will definitely return.

ibmX9j0jF6zd59SQQysQjw.text: So this was my first time ordering from here and I must say I'm not really that satisfied. I ordered my breakfast through Uber Eats and it got here pretty fast but other then that it sucked! I ordered waffles and an omelette. Before I completed my order I put special notes under each item and a special not before checkout just to reiterate my previous notes. I also called to have them look up my order and repeat my special notes just to make sure they got it right. When my order arrived NONE of the items where in my bag. Not even syrup for my waffles and that's crazy. Two of the waffles come with powder sugar and I even called and asked to make sure it was some on the waffle and on the side! So I called back once I realized my stuff was missing and they came back to redeliver what was missing and there was still no POWDER SUGAR!!! lol how can they be that dumbbbbbbb?! I'm so upset and I'll never order from there! Not to mention I spent about $80 to be in happy!

PjBJ82TsfhHPSQ3YNdRE_g.text: Everything was delicious! Portions were huge! Very good pancake. Staff was super friendly. Get the Chilaquiles. New favorite breakfast place. I'll try the mimosa next time.

It was good, nothing special, its huge so i took half home along with like 75% of the giant pancake! (Pancake is still fantastic the next day. ) My party ordered a meaty skillet and that was also nothing special. Potatoes are a little bland, but everything was fixed with the nice hot sauce they had there. Really enjoyed this place (basically just the pancakes) lol

o8eG4ow0BtW8e00NtV2kiQ.text: So delicious! I got the chorizo skillet and it was amazing and so was the salsa. Ordered my eggs over medium and that's how they came. The only downside is, as a southerner, the bread that came with it isn't what I would call a biscuit. Very doughy, more like a really thick dinner roll. I'd still eat here again though.

6ZOrlWEdZ8LUXh0HBMcT4Q.text: And why haven't you been in here yet?!?!   This could be my second or third review but I don't care.  I love this place the food is so good, I know they just opened but I feel like this place should be bursting at the seams with people.   I initially tried this place bc of Groupon ...  and trust me I'm so happy that I did.  I love the service the chefs, owners ...  but the food is 5 stars, my friend said the chilaquilles were as good as his moms (I'll have to take his word for it this is the first time I have ever had it) but the crab and prawn Benedict...  it's delicious best I have ever had, I have had a lot of bennies in my life but this is a memorable one.  The seasoned potatoes are a must.  Perfect executed the hollandaise is fresh and not too thin or thick, the English muffin is perfectly toasted and the crab and prawn patty is all meat, everything well seasoned with a perfectly poached egg and some avocado to tie it all, well this is a dish that will bring you back.

photos.caption: Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu is so diverse and the crab bennies and the chillaquiles are to drool over

lDCmBV5iAapjuvt_nmIN3A.text: The best pancakes I've had in Vegas.  The service is amazing.  Everyone here cares about your experience.   I have been here many times and have never been disappointed.   Highly recommend.

mbJQfp8KFyTFExWczm89nw.text: Food is awesome!  Ok,  there are no mimosas, so get over it.  Liquor license coming soon.  Well worth checking out!

j1XqVhIlgkEaV-ejeIbQfQ.text: Great breakfast/lunch spot. Their portion sizes are humongous! I got the Meat Skillet. It was delicious, had bacon, sausage, steak and the potatoes are super tasty. The homemade orange juice and biscuit are so delicious.  The biscuit is huge and soft. The rest of my family enjoyed their Huevos Rancheros, steak omelette, double cheeseburger. I definitely recommend this place. I can't wait until they start serving their famous mimosas. The service was great, little wait time, the food was served warm and we continued to receive round the clock service. This is one satisfied customer!!!

YHAEPmoGZpjDeF1GYh9TEg.text: First the coffee is not good, overly bitter. With that said the food was good. The pancakes was one of the better in town, crispy surface with fluffy insides. Will we be back.... Maybe.

keIE9GL53f9K5F79Cq6rnA.text: One of the best breakfasts we have had in awhile. I had the shrimp and crab omelette and it was huge.  Crab was very fresh and delicious. It was clear that our waitress enjoyed her job and made our visit fun. Give this place a try, you won't be disappointed.

yGPvEJ-A_EZ76Lu0tcolkA.text: The food here is AMAZING! Don't let the location fool you, the food is five star gourmet. Huge portions. My boyfriend who never has leftovers could only eat half his meal!  The crab and Avocado Benedict was great, potatoes were cooked perfectly. Looks like Egg Works and The cracked Egg has some competition! We will be returning to try more on the menu.

6_n5tL1Frv6lg7AvntiG4w.text: This place does not look fancy - but the food is really good.  My companion and I shared a crab & shrimp omelet with hash browns and toast.  The omelet was fantastic! The service was fantastic.  They have quite an extensive breakfast menu with tons of choices.  I will definitely go back and try something new!

4b0DJiGAoSEDFMTJ2k5iJA.text: I been creeping on this restaurant for about two weeks now, I am happy I finally tried it!! Customer service was A++ , from beginning to end. Im a big coffee drinker and they defiantly get extra brownie points for not having the basic diner coffee ( Water downed coffee) . I can't wait for them to get their liquor license  so I could try their famous mimosas!!!

zWEb7l8J_d-a-4JAp9qaiA.text: Tried this place on a whim after it popped up on my FB feed. I had the chicken & apple sausage and a pneapple mimosa. My husband tried the western scramble. The portions were huge, service was impeccable-this place did not disappoint.

gjdKIlhgPuf7v6B7Ci_Kww.text: Came here about a month ago with a couple of my friends who were visiting. Found it through yelp due to its great reviews. I got a vegetarian omelette and a mango mimosa. Serving sizes are big and their potatoes are AMAZING!!! My mimosa was good although I couldn't really taste much mango, mostly champagne hahaha That's not really a bad thing though! They even have massive ones for I believe $35 so your whole table can share (or just you lol). I put us on the wait list through the Yelp app and when we got there, we checked in and were almost instantly sat. So cool! If the restaurant you're looking at has a wait list option, do it! It'll make your life so much easier! Definitely recommend this place! It was pretty packed when we came too, which is always a good sign!

OaT5RE1ZzFh4JPjK9Rsywg.text: This is a pretty good breakfast spot. The staff was super friendly and our waiter was super helpful in making decisions in terms of what we wanted to eat and what we wanted to drink. We got the super Mimosa. You're able to get more than one flavor however it is at your risk. Some flavors don't mix well. We got the strawberry/pineapple and it was super good. Make sure that you pick up the straw after you slurp some of the Mimosa down, Otherwise the drink will spill on the table. The food was overall good and were pretty large portions for what the price was. I would definitely come back.

fDEIReJ8ADM8l6pPMGeP1g.text: Update: the server just messaged me requesting to take down this review and called me a liar. How about "Sorry for your poor experience, how can we make it better next time?" Proof of horrible customer service. After trying to go back and forth with me claiming he didn't try to over charge me, he mocked me saying "haha I have the proof I did not do that" this is the type of server that is at this establishment. He wrote to me under the name Jose.  Their servers call people who left honest poor reviews "liars" and mock people through messages. Calling me a liar after he brought out over charged slips for my bill. He kept calling me "sir" in the messages even though it was a table of 3 girls! Doesn't even remember so how can he call me a liar?  The only reason this place is getting two stars is because the food is good. The service and respect just isn't there. They don't take reservations so I called to put my name on the waitlist for a party of 3 prior to getting there. They told me about 45 mins-1 hour. They then text me 30 mins later saying my table is ready even though they told me 45 min-1 hour. I went to the hostess to tell them my friends are not here yet but will be here in about 10, mins. She told me she had to give my table away then. Even tho it wasn't at the 45-1 hour mark. After my friends showed up I told her we are all here and she said we would be next. Then I see her seating people who got there after us and when I asked her how much longer she said "Well I already had your table ready." Then after we ate we asked to have the check split between 3 of us. An $81 bill should come to $27 each. They charged my two girlfriends $27 and then the waiter charged me $60. Doesn't even make sense. So I asked him if he could correct it and he tells me "don't freak out." Ok..... not freaking out! Just pointing that you charged us $60 more.. we then ordered two more drinks after the bill and he kept showing us in our face "is this right? See the check? This is correct right?" Mocking us. Not our fault he didn't calculate right the first time. Then after being there about 90 mins the waiter basically comes over and kicks us out because he have been there for 90 mins and there is a 90 min limit. That's fine but if I'm still finishing my drink and we had to take 20 mins out of our brunch time so you can fix our check then that is NOT the customer's fault! We also were all being stared at by everyone until we got up and left at about 95 mins. Will never come here and don't recommend it. AND THERE's NO AIR CONDITIONING! people were literally fanning themselves with the menu. In Vegas when it is 96 degrees that is unacceptable!

GuibE4XuBC42n2FdvsTH6g.text: I really loved how fun this place was, from topping the birthday celebrant with a sombrero to the level of excitement from the staff.  I ordered their crab, prawn, and avocado Benedict while my husband got their famous fried chicken Benedict. Staff was really friendly and tentative, price point was reasonable, and they spot was definitely better than your average.  :)

Y6lLTnza72m3NdWEVuPU5g.text: I swear they put something in the mimosas!!! Their super mimosas are no joke. We were a party of 5 and ended up finishing off 3. Let's say we felt it for sure. We tried the guava, prickly pear and lychee. Lychee was by far our favorite - not too sweet and really had lychee flavoring you expect. As far as the food goes, it's your basic breakfast place. Lots of Benedict options, omelettes, French toast options. The food was good - probably not the best breakfast food in all of vegas but worth coming in (mimosas or not)!

bm2zjfttFanseVWUDBb6EQ.text: I can't say enough how much I love Mimosas. I write this review selfishly hoping no one else feels the same so that I don't have to share or wait hours on end to eat.   First of all, the mimosas. So many flavors. I've tried almost all and have yet to dislike one. Standouts for me are guava and kiwi. And if you're feeling extra lush, there's a huge mega mimosa that runs around $30. Which is saying a lot because the individual serving is rather massive. I can normally power through a few rounds of mimosa with brunch and be fine but I always catch a buzz here by the second bowl. Yeah, I said bowl.  They don't serve little skimpy flute here. You got a damn mini punch bowl. And you'll like it. Dammit.   But it's not just the mimosas, the food is great, too. The portions are generous, the flavors are on point, and there is a great selection to choose from. Oh and for $1, you can upgrade your toast to a pancake the size of Cinderella's pumpkin that I think qualifies as one of the best in the valley.   But it's not just the mimosas and the food, the service is fantastic. The servers are genuinely friendly and attentive. It's always great when the staff seems proud of their restaurant. To that end, I probably would have taken longer to try to kiwi mimosa had it not been for our server mentioning it was her personal favorite out of their new flavors.   The location can be a bit tricky, but just look for the Arby's.   Do yourself a favor and grab yourself a mimosa... or two. Or more if you took a rideshare in.  Cheers!

--f9bARoS-7crj2ByujRbg.text: Nice "mimosa" spot!  Service was great!  Had drinks filled the whole time!  I ordered the S'mores Nutella French Toast and two mimosas (strawberry and papaya).  Presentation: 4.5  Quantity: 4.1  Taste: 4.2 (super sweet)  Price: 2.1 (place next door had "bottomless mimosas" for $12, $8.5 per here) Service: 2.9 (took a huge hit because splitting of bill meant I paid on two tickets / cost server $1 tip on one bill) Seating: 0.2 (sat by front door where guest were allowed to stand waiting for tables with their asses in our faces, they should do away with this booth, plenty of seating when I came in)  Staff: 4.7 (very attentive).  Overall I will return to this spot!  It was great food and drinks!  Just the seating and the spitting of the bill were my issue, nothing to scoff at when I was looking for food! ki6lyDBmmzEenU65u1MFCw.text: We had a very good breakfast here during our most recent stay in LV. There are a lot of breakfast options, and I opted for (can't remember the name) a full plate of red potatoes, chorizo, sausage, bacon, onions, with an egg on top. Very good with a little spicy kick. The biscuit was dry and bland. My wife ordered a huge order of french toast with blueberries and strawberries. Each dish could have fed two. The kids breakfast meals were pretty standard but good.   The also serve Mimosas.

nuOpWKvWL69TzLFshWGZOA.text: First time here to celebrate my daughter's 12th birthday. We called a head of time to reserve our table since we had a large group, we were told about 20 min wait for our table became over an hour. After finally getting in, we immediately looked at the menu, ordered our drinks and food. Food came out pretty quick and kitchen was busy. Once everyone in our party got their food, we all started to eat, BUT the moment I looked down on my plate, I saw a long hair in my sauce and stretching out on my over easy eggs. Waved down  a server to fix issue and they took my plate away. 3 min later they came back with my re-plated food in a smaller plate and re-cooked eggs. One mistake kitchen did wrong was to send my food in a smaller plate, they should've at least re-plated on a same size plate as the first plate it came in the first time, which already gave the hint that kitchen only made new eggs, took the hair out and added more sauce. Price for the meat lover skillet meal I believe a little pricey for having tons of large diced potatoes and carne asada size cut meat, sausage and bacon, could at least cut the beef a little bigger. Server also explained that my meal would be taken out of the check which I did appreciate for having a hair in it, but when we were done dining and ready to pay, my meal was still on the check, when then we called the server over. They also have a drink special that came in a very large wine glass, which a customer who just turned 21 ordered that sat adjacent to our table. She had 15 minutes to finish it and if she did, she would get it for free, but that wasn't the case, poor birthday girl threw up and made tracks running to the restroom, we were at least done eating before the incident happened. Overall, place is rocking and would probably give them another try.

fpIZEE2hgMMOA_Nm8oad4A.text: WOW. I was blown away by this place the other day. I went for brunch with my gf and we got the chicken fried steak with gravy and biscuits along with the s'mores French toast. Let me tell you. Every component on the dish was prepared and cooked to perfection. Most places have dishes that are too salty or too sweet- not this place. Not only are their dishes super flavorful and high quality, but they are Very generous with portions.   Hats off to the chef because the chicken was well seasoned and breaded, the biscuit  was moist and soft (best biscuits I've ever had), the gravy was super delicious, along with the perfectly cooked hash browns on the side.   Now to the French toast. They make their bread homemade here, and you can tell. Thick cut French toast with delicious toppings. I would say this is the best French toast I've had in years. The service here is super friendly, very quick, and it's a very cozy atomosphere. Next time we will try their mimosas, I'm sure they are to die for!

lIN7hcpFVIQmU2UimSFmjw.text: I have found my new favorite breakfast meal: the Smoked Salmon Benedict! Portion is huge and flavors are on point. Muffin base, tons of salmon, poached egg, add spinach, red onion, and capers, and top it all off with hollandaise. It tastes even better than it looks, and I ate way more than my stomach could comfortably hold just because it was so tasty. The home style potatoes with peppers and onions went really well with this and the excess sauce on the plate. When I come back, it's going to be hard to take a chance ordering anything else!  The Chile Verde Omelet was a less successful dish for us, but I'm eyeing the Chicken Enchilada version for next time. Note that you can substitute pancakes for your side of toast for just a buck- and theirs are made with a sweet cream buttermilk and they're good even eaten plain. I love that their coffee cups are so large, so we didn't need to look around for refills. Service was attentive and genuinely friendly, will be coming back soon for more.

cl5Q1dA_NwPNvYA5ySooww.text: Up Early ready for our day, love to start it off with breakfast. This place popped into our minds and so we stopped by. No one in the place, it's a Monday, so that's perhaps why?   It's fresh, clean and spacious inside. We were greeted right away and made to feel welcomed. After drink orders, we were left to look over the menu. They serve breakfast and lunch, so it's a rather large menu.  My husband asked to start with the Nutella waffles, they came with bananas, berries and whipped cream. The waffle was crispy around the edges and the mixed berries were fresh.  For my breakfast, I got the chili verde and eggs. It came with choice of eggs, potatoes, re fried beans and corn tortillas.  Everything was tasty and cooked well.   My husband, a big eater, got the chicken fried steak  breakfast, came with mashed-covered in milk gravy. Just a little different flavor, had rosemary in the gravy. He got scrambled eggs and hash browns. Really big meal!   Overall, good service, great food and decent prices. We will come back for breakfast for sure but better yet we'll try lunch.

fsv1BOe9I0K1wx3rmxllNw.text: Undercooked oily fries.  Waffles taste cheap batter no flavor.  Also had the egg Benedict and again the English muffin tasted stale like it was bought from 99cent store. I can't explain it but if you eat enough quality stuff you will understand.   Might as well go to Denny's.   Mimosa is the only thing that's they perfect on.

cUEUFCj_Z0kdepqKs6IFRQ.text: Talk about an experience! Been here three times, now they have a liquor license. The food here is phenomenal, huge portions. My wife and I had the california benedict, & it was delicious. She has also had the nutella french toast and it was amazing! Their mimosas are great, an abundance of flavors and are strong! The best part is the loud music and family vibes. Everyone at Mimosas is welcoming. Go here!

J3djKzzBJTU5oGPIinsV7w.text: Came here today for brunch with my best friend! Ordered a bloody Mary and a Michelada to share ..I'm very picky with my michelada because I like mine with clamato and they actually had clamato!!!! I was so happy! I ordered the smoke salmon Benedict which was so good..the salmon was not fishy at all ..it all melted in my mouth..so good! My bestie ordered the crab and shrimp Benedict..also very Good! Last but not least we had to try that churro waffle..it was basically a waffle with sprinkled cinnamon and sugar and a scoop of ice cream! Overall the service was OK..they were really busy and only a couple servers..I understand.. I'll be back to try other things for sure! Maybe a mimosa next time!

a6pZFvODrnnHfRkpHNxqng.text: the concept is good however size over quality is clearly their forte.  the overly large biscuit was a little too brown on the bottom for my taste. what should have been the supporting star of my fried chicken benedict, over shadowed the fried chicken.  the fried chicken would have been great because it was cooked perfectly, in oil that clearly needed to be changed out. the potatoes in the corned beef hash also superseded the corned beef. service is almost impeccable.  overkill is more the word. this place was decent but i dont think its anything to rave over

5VNQ_dUuzDZVqdmQ0o-fZg.text: Another great day. We are back at Mimosas for a great breakfast. A day of shopping and hanging out with the wife. We love the Las Vegas life !!!

uJSHxyWGVUkDyjYPwt75bw.text: Ok, so ironically Mimosas Gourmet does  not yet have a liquor license but I'm not about to hold that against them. Breakfast was huge and also yummy. Coffee was decent service was fast and friendly. I had the Diablo skillet which was very good I especially loved the homemade biscuit. My daughter had the Castro Benedict which was even better than my breakfast! She always orders eggs benedict whenever we go to breakfast and thought that this was one of the best ones that she's ever had. We will definitely be back!
