7pVsoBcVtUTOIgJQUyFG3g.text: I had an awesome experience at this spot. The customer service was impeccable. I feel like every server in the restauraunt asked if we were good during our time at Mimosa Gourmet. The food was okay. I ordered the Herb Chicken Skillet. It was good but I did have to utiluze a little salt and pepper. The mimosa was okay; A little on the sweet side with the puree and champagne combo. The overall experience was great though. I am a fan of customer services and theyvarr at the top of my list.

2xgMEMcZfhacY4nHMKmC6w.text: Location isn't the greatest, located in the back corner of a shopping center and almost didn't look open. Decor is.. different but service was great. We were greeted and seated very kindly and service stayed that way throughout our time there. A lot of options on the menu. I went with the breakfast quesadilla and my boyfriend did the pancake combo. Pancakes were really good! Big size, good flavor, soft and fluffy.  Wasn't thrilled on the mimosa's which is what I was looking forward to the most. I got the prickly pear and took 2 sips. It tasted like cough syrup. I informed the waitress towards the end of our meal that I didn't like it, sure she could tell by how full my glass was and she apologized, took it back and we didn't get charged for it.  Would possibly go back if in the area but not somewhere I would drive out of my way to go too.

JCpjybw1BnBshAl-J6auVg.text: Yummm! The mimosas here are delicious, my boyfriend and I got the pomegranate one! They're served in a huge glass, so be careful, they're dangerous ;) I think we were seated by the owner, he was very nice. The menu is big.The staff was very attentive to us and super friendly. Can't wait to come back!

RaZ_ZZS7NP8Vrm1HRO-07w.text: Fantastic breakfast/brunch/lunch spot! The food is amazing and fresh to order. So don't mind the wait. Trust it's worth it

sgr8ZXnfqUKS3NCJxS-mDA.text: food is bomb and the service also  and as an LVNE executive CHEF n chef owner  I loved the food AWESOME breakfasts and latin breakfasts too

CDMUYvCuWxju8TvzCtxZYw.text: Very good Pomegranate Mimosa but brunch dishes were the star of the visit.  Excellent corned beef hash and chilaquiles - top notch.  Service was great too - very friendly and attentive.  Great option for breakfast, brunch or lunch.  Highly recommended.

IG0MhujjAu7xcwaVzET64Q.text: Best French toast I've ever had. Large portions and very flavorful!  Service staff is very friendly and pleasant. Everyone in our party was very satisfied and we would definitely come back.

rlTecp_F9oDVCwITEdNQKQ.text: Tucked away in a strip center is a wonderful breakfast restaurant. We ordered the Diablo Skillet and Nutella Waffle. The Diablo was a delicious mix of chorizo, potatoes, eggs and vegges. The Nutella waffle was decadent with just enough strawberries & bananas. Our waitress was so friendly and breakfast came quickly. We plan on going again tomorrow to try a couple other options that we wanted. Good luck to this newer restaurant.

3XDupr4KTE7n-ZVGFNvDcA.text: The food here is wonderful!  Been here twice now with granddaughter and she loves the food also.  Service is great!  Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is the coffee not very good to me. But the orange juice is like they just squeezed it.  Very yummy but portions are large so come hungry.

kyrPE_cL0Yq0C5-2H9AEKQ.text: First time there and food was excellent and service was friendly and attentive.  Menu has a broad selection of breakfast and lunch options. Decor is a little bland but we didn't go for atmosphere.

6UQLUlydMz5TACa1cmdM5w.text: Best place in the world!!!!!!!!!!!!! Chile verde is amazing and the California omelet is above exceptional. The people here are amazing and very kind. I am just overwhelmed with how nice and kind the people are there. The cooks are brilliant making everything fresh and presentation is beautiful. Please GO and SuPport this business.bits worth every penny

wjiWiBBrsSBUjgq2y8gkNA.text: THE BEST CASUAL RESTAURANT IN LAS VEGAS! I took my mother and sister here for a birthday brunch and it was ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC! The service was impeccable, warm, friendly and attentive without being intrusive. Everyone was genuinely nice and put their heart into everything they served. And oh my God was the food good! It was unbelievable delicious! The portions are truly enormous (my fluffy, light, heavenly, homemade buttermilk pancakes were bigger than my head!) everything was fresh, homemade and delicious! The chef is definitely creating world class cuisine in this little spot-its like a secret that has yet to be discovered. The Mimosas were made with hand squeezed orange juice and were so light and refreshing.  And they have a wide range of menu options for breakfast and lunch, something sure to please everyone. Mimosas Gourmet offers high end food without break the bank prices. They definitely could be charging more -huge portions and the very best ingredients but the bill was extremely reasonable. When they found out it was my mother's birthday, they made her feel so special and the owner even came over to give her a gift certificate for a free future meal. I can't recommend this restaurant hard enough...I have lived and traveled around the world and know a good thing when I see it...Mimosas Gourmet is a hidden gem and you should definitely check them out before everyone discovers them and you can't get a seat!

5-pun02D3B-OathytNdQJw.text: don't come here if you want any alcoholic drinks!!! they dont have their liquor license!

sVZ1P0NxA1htB4J2JEBGdw.text: I don't understand how this place can receive such high ratings. They don't have a liquor license so they can't serve you mimosas which is the whole concept behind their name. We walked in and pretty much had to seat ourselves. The bench wasn't bolted down nor were the tables which seemed strange. The food took forever to order and was bland when it came out. I ordered a protein scramble and had to cover it in tapatio in order to eat it. The home style potatoes looked like they would be flavorful but they left me disappointed. My friend ordered the corn beef hash and said the same thing. The service was alright but it took forever to get our check and even longer for them to pick it up. Now, if a restaurant is busy I am more patient but when there are only 2 tables that are occupied, there is no excuse for poor service. I will never return to this place and would turn anyone away from here.

GTRyZGAyLvW2eZUERppDQQ.text: We stopped here for a quick breakfast and were pleasantly surprised!! The food is really good and the service was also great.

GR8kpM8CdVhJEpDD7fkMmA.text: was looking for something tasty to eat and stumbled across this gem on uber eats . i ordered the eggs benedict and got my four year old the pancake breakfast and my mom the salmon and eggs and potatoe situation with capers . everyone was very pleased with their meals . the food was quite tasty and i'm glad that i found this place .

pf-vVXZB9RXpiUX0wguGVA.text: Food was delicious! Service was super slow. I couldn't order any mimosas because they didn't have a liquor license. On their menu they apologized for the inconvenience and I believe that they are working on getting their liquor license again.

25dROhWpAC0zYagHDjlhfQ.text: Came here on a day off. It's a must try spot in Vegas. The food was great, I had the waffle breakfast and my friend meal lover's scramble which we both enjoyed. The mimosas are delicious. We tried the pomegranate and guava mimosas which we both thoroughly enjoyed. Portions are huge (both food and mimosas). I will definitely be back!

OhB6ai2zDEDMF1j0WqmSfA.text: VERY pleasantly surprised by this place. Simple and understated but the food was AMAZING!! I had the corned beef hash skillet and everything was cooked to perfection!! (Very hard to find good, tender corned beef) Will definitely be back! Important to support quality, small businesses like these folks!

nI3D2bSMLm6zKCOLOzvhug.text: This is my absolute favorite place to go to for breakfast! The food is super delicious and is consistent every single time I come here, which is very important. The atmosphere is very comfortable and the owner is friendly. If you're thinking of making a visit to this wonderful restaurant, just do it. You won't regret it. As a tip, make sure to try their hot sauce. It's the best!

aAvkpMfLOt7AxJ-f-zNuXQ.text: Loved this place.  Went here with some girlfriends the other day and we all cannot wait to go back.  The food is so delicious, the flavors are unbelievable.  The service was excellent and super friendly.  The prices are decent, but the portion size is just huge!   Can't wait to go back. Everyone  must try!

7Ak2La1JqP6hfkMOkipRTg.text: I took my son here for breakfast and it was amazing. My son ate their biscuit and gravy and states great. I was very impressed with their eggs Benedict.  Very good size portion.

dg5uZ4RA5ToeyLKlnZDoIw.text: Spacious and comfortable seating. Huge menu with lots of breakfast and lunch items. We enjoyed the eggs benedict and the BBLT (BLT with a lot of B). The huge portion of breakfast potatoes was great and the fries were good too. I'm looking forward to returning.

DhSmTZxOFdAnmH_YNyrZvw.text: Wow.....the food is amazingly good. Authentic breakfast flavors from Mexico. Portions are definitely worth your money.

tcLTMLRthwhwhDZQZ5OYrw.text: I don't comment too much but this place is very good. I had the smoked salmon skillet   It was very tasty and it served with seasoned potatoes and egg.  Very well balanced.  The blueberry short stack pancake is delicious.  The chief and the waitress were very nice.  Definitely give this a try as many food here are made in house.

CwgfvOZbuyGQ3ZgmOBV-Iw.text: Wonderful food, excellent service and overall an amazing family business run by genuinely kind people. There isn't a bad item on the menu. The portions are huge and the price is perfect!!! We are regulars and our family loves coming here. We feel so welcome and I would rate this one of the best local breakfast joints in Vegas!!!! You will not be disappointed.

A_fZM6ldRBKPlfp009IEpg.text: On their website it says that they open at six in the morning. Today we arrived at about 615 in the morning on the front door it reads they open Monday through Friday 6 AM. Alongside there was a sinus says were closed. Evidently they don't open at six in the morning and you're just too lazy to change things to let people know. I live in Henderson we drove 23 miles to not have breakfast there change your signs change your website don't think I'll go back no telling when they're open

yeQxfCW3K8Ct2S7-qX3WlA.text: Decided to try breakfast one morning around 9:30am, think it was a Monday or Tueday.  I ordered the breakfast quesadilla with home fries while my partner just had toast and jelly with his coffee. Coffee came in huge mug-like coffee cups, and was quite good. Toast came next, along with a good selection of Smuckers jelly pods to choose from, including strawberry, mixed fruit, and orange marmalade, my favorite, even though I wasn't the one eating it today.  If I had known how huge my quesadilla was going to be, I probably would have looked for something smaller, because it was so packed with eggs, cheese, sausage, and bacon in a tortilla sandwich that covered a huge plate, I could barely eat a quarter of it with some potatoes and a little side of chipotle type salsa. No problem. It was tasty and filling the following two days as well after having to take the leftovers home.  Service was good and the management kindly turned down the somewhat loud music for us to better conduct some business after our meal.  I hope to come back for the churro waffle and ice cream soon.

PEQ_rVSVEiFLEgL3bENQxg.text: No joke, what a wonderful place to eat breakfast..indeed the salmon dish is amazing.. great service as well...well worth the visit!!!!

s9MRlf3SLS3xv9I0w4mu_A.text: The food servings are huge! I share my meals almost every time I go there. Everything I've tried so far has been delicious.  The service is great also. Very nice people work there. And of course, the mimosas! They have so many flavors to choose from. I love this place!

q9cdZ7LsFvKH0klZSXsm4Q.text: Been here several times.  Great French toast,  blt  is excellent.  Service is outstanding.

vagx4n-nJDvfWQFmnNCjJw.text: Wow amazing!  Met some friends here for monthly brunch and had chilliquelles; my friends had quevos rancheros, and veggie skillet.  Every aspect is wonderful from the coffee to food to service.  Will frequent this place; happy to have found it :)

upRrYL-i8FDaKSVt1b6BEA.text: One of the best breakfasts I've had in this area. Everything was fresh and good portions. The staff was incredibly nice.

MFnmBRTptvzkmyZN54Ko7g.text: Awesome huevos rancheros with chunky potatoes! I crave food like this, but have a hard time finding a restaurant with decent dishes like this near Spring Valley or the West side for that matter. But I really liked this one dish.  I also had the Nutella waffle with banana and strawberries and it did not disappoint. The waffle was really soft and the toppings were on point, didn't even need syrup.  The coffee is also pretty good, strong and bold, but not exactly liquid crack.

eX1_Wm4erOYhILUG3IPoug.text: The food is okay. The side of eggs which is like $4 is so small which you can see in the picture. I got the Banana French Toast it's pretty big and it's fairly good. The service isn't that great. One of the workers after taking someone's order is standing behind the counter eating what seems like her little sisters food (which is weird to have at your workplace and behind the counter) but she's eating her food then comes out to take an order while chewing.. The inside is not appealing to the eye. Way too many color schemes going on. They seem to care more about the uber eats and postmarks orders than the customers that are right in front of them. Overall I may return but only if I have nothing to do for my day cause the food also took quite some time to get to me. 6/10

W-VOvFeqMNwq9v88Gvving.text: Another great breakfast place in Vegas. Service was incredible, food was excellent(I had the chilaquiles) and the restaurant was very clean. Hard to decide which of the places in Vegas we liked better for breakfast, coin toss but both were excellent.

-cwQ2AggmXfR46SmRhmp0A.text: A diamond in the rough..   The restaurant is packed in the back corner of a virtually dead shopping center, I was skeptical.   I walk in and im immediately suspicious of: Purple and yellow decor and the lack of people inside. We sit and look at the menu which was pretty big, and I decide on the veggie skillet and proceeded to talk about how these breakfast places never have something for vegetarians, just vegetarian options. I was being petty.. .   The food comes out. I knew at that point that I was so wrong. And should be ashamed of myself. Lol. The portion size was a bit above average which is code for perfect. I've been on the vegetarian spectrum for quite some time and I feel like this was one of the best representations of vegetarian food. (lacto-ovo specifically) the veggies tasted so good. The sauce to veggie ratio was good. Like it felt homemade. I just can't get over it.   My girlfriend had the corned beef and she was gushing over her plate for a while as well. She was a fan of how well cooked the onions were. But the beef was the star for her.   All in all. The prices were decent. The decor is just as goofy as all other breakfast diners and the food is the bomb. Will return many times. Hope they last in that terrible location.

--VzAhm4NgDv0CsNhWELaw.text: My favorite breakfast spot in Vegas. Food is delicious. Portions are huge (the BF and I often split a skillet). Staff is great. Coffee keeps coming. The drinks, er, well, sometimes they serve alcohol, sometimes they don't. On the couple occasions we've been here and they're pouring drinks, drinks are good. Today, however, a sign was posted on the front door, and in the menu, that they're waiting for their liquor license. C'mon county, give them their dang license!! Also today, they had a table set up outside with complimentary coffee while you waited for a table. We didn't have a wait but it was a nice touch.   I've had the meat skillet, veggie skillet, Mexican skillet and the eggs benedict. Never have we left disappointed with the food.   Even without the alcohol, I'd highly recommend this place.

VsuqtPlOXQnLoqU4iJ_VOw.text: Excellent and very friendly family atmosphere. The food is plentiful and very inventive and best of all, very tasty. There were three of us in the party and everyone had the best meal they have ever had. Thank you for the excellent work. We will be back...

lJiICTV5foNR3Ck_Rwsb2Q.text: The food is delicious, portions are huge. Prices are reasonable. The service was also on point; consistent refills, provided all sauces and condiments, food came out at a timely matter. We only came to Vegas to visit and this restaurant was the perfect start for our last day. If we would've stayed longer, we would've came more than just once.

A9aV0iLulaLS5mZ8mvG_HA.text: First time going today and I have to say, it was the best decision for breakfast. I have gone to Hispanic restaurants where they serve CHILAQUILES but, they're soggy. My biggest pet peeve! Not this place, they had crunch to it! It was a very clean, open space environment. People were attentive, nice and checked on us every now and then. I can't wait to go back.

6uquKGczvETxfHumPDW2Hg.text: This place was just ok for me. I thought I'd have a mimosa hence the name but they had a sticker over the mimosa options stating they don't have a liquor license. Anyways I got the chicken and waffles which we're nothing special. We were taken care of by three people, one of which who had white cold sore medicine on the lips! The orange juice was the best I've had by far, but probably won't be back.

_C7mdH3YUv4PguARRSqnDA.text: I really enjoyed my brunch here. We were going hiking, so didn't partake in the mimosa, but they looked great, and came with several flavour variations. Food was tasty, and the staff were very friendly.

ImrtdDHauXhNbx4NaZFGYQ.text: Amazing food, large portions and excellent service. They gave me a 20% off card. We definitely came back

81ZE9cLA97JDAmdkcFXhDA.text: Aaaaaaamazaing! And at such reasonable prices. The eggs, bacon and hash browns were all perfectly cooked, exactly to my order and it tasted great. The coffee was great, and the service was great too, everyone smiled and was attentive.  I'm literally gonna start coming here 3 times a week so I can try everything on the menu!

e3ud9458KWTCMuBv04ZbAQ.text: It's nice to see a breath of life being brought back to the Strip Mall behind Arby's on Durango and Spring Mountain Rd.  I read some of the reviews for this place and decided to give it a shot. I tried the Crab, Prawn, Sliced Avocado Benedict with potatoes,and a cup of coffee. Everything tasted great, the Hollandaise sauce had good flavor, just enough Crab, Shrimp and Avocado on a toasted English Muffin. The grilled potatoes with a touch of onion and peppers was great with a really large portion. Even the coffee was outstanding, it had sort of a European, French Roast flavor.  The servers were very friendly and always made sure that everything was OK. They have a very extensive menu, including a large selection Mimosas I will definitely be back to try their other items out!

RaNjLp2cEQNhB8CiSXKwrg.text: Great food and friendly service! We ordered the Eggs Benedict with crab & avocado and the Pancakes with bananas and Strawberries. The flavor on both dishes was on point! Very yummy! Deducted one star because the banana in pancakes wasn't quite ripe, which made it hard to chew. Other than that everything was great, will definitely be back.

VUzXNH1VTP0ND_GdLSBR7g.text: Mimosas Gourmet has truly delicious food no bs, stopped in here for Brunch today and my gf and I were immediately seated my gf ordered the California Benedict & I had the Cajun chicken sandwich and we were both seriously surprised at the portions they are huge so we had to take to go because more than half of our food would be go to waste. The food took a hot minute but! that is because everything is made Fresh! wonderful place excellent service!

6ZGQu8AFyOiERHzlTtKjrw.text: Food was very good. Friendly staff. The 2 stars is mainly due to the fact that a place called Mimosas Gourmet currently does NOT serve Mimosas or any type of alcohol. We were told they're still waiting for their liquor license from the county.  Pretty disappointed to go to a place on our Sunday only to find out they're not serving what's featuring the menu.

ofA4Rk-65pw2nsnPEXlcVg.text: OMG. Food is amazing. Huge portions. No liquor license yet but you can byob. Everything was great you will not be disappointed if you love breakfast and a lot of it!!!!

UpbNzqU7lFEy5inkoz6QEw.text: Finally tried this place earlier today. Very close to my house so that's a plus. We were greeted and seated quickly.   I ordered a coffee which was good and the size was big. The mug was a good size and I liked that. My wife ordered their original mimosas which was in a mason jar with fruit and it tasted pretty good. The orange juice taste fresh.   The food was good. However, my potatoes were just "Warm" like they've been sitting for a few minutes after it was already plated and ready to go. The food didn't really give me a wow factor. But the portions was on point.   I thought this place was cute and the food and portions were good. I'm taking one star away because it took a while for our and the place wasn't that busy. I already finished a cup of coffee and my wife finished her mimosa by the time we finally got our food. Granted I saw a lot of Uber Eats bags being prepared but still. Hungry customers aren't a good thing! Lol.   I would return for their portions and the convenient location. But I was a bit disappointed for that missing "wow" factor.

DrnS5sgWBPph46Lo_GvVlg.text: Found a new favorite! Right up the street from my house. DELICIOUS huevos rancheros. My boyfriend and I were very excited that they use queso fresco. We also got the diablo skillet. The potatoes are packed with flavor and the salsa on the side is a perfect compliment. We will definitely be back to have a mimosa and try something new

photos.caption: Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos rancheros and diablo skillet

4e7vkNYr_qVoBRUwhqFxEQ.text: OH MY GOD... first thing that comes to your mind when you see your food. Amazing food, excellent service, everything about this restaurant was so good. We came from Chicago, saw this groupon and couldn't pass it up. $26 for $40 worth of food for 4 people is a great deal, drinks were on point and hats off to the chef. Quick tip: If you are not familiar with this spot they give generous portions (lots of food), beware!! 5 stars for sure.. must try. We will be back!  Thank you, Mimosas Gourmet & Las Vegas!

kAgXVZGAEXkUuAR_QZ0KYA.text: So I've traveled a lot. Been to a million brunch places. This one blew me away. I could care less if anyone disagrees with me. The food was great. Everything was good. Bread, potatos, meat, butter (lol) sour cream, good omelet and great service. Being a huge mimosa lover myself, I perused the different mimosa juices. The lovely server suggested lychee, and just one put me in the clouds. I don't think I'll ever go anywhere else in Vegas for brunch except for one place on the strip. Good job guys

iV5FhT_DjLdtoa42MRut-w.text: Came here for brunch with friends I was very impress with the reviews so we decided to come here. Everything was good up until the food was about to be served, everyone got their food my other friend finished and my food was still not out I literally had to cancel it and eat somewhere else. You suppose to at least bring half of the orders first and proceed to the second half nxt but no they serve the 1st half and did not serve our 2nd part instead they keep serving other tables when we are still waiting for our. Drinks are good portions are decent but I'm not coming back here no more. Kitchen sucks and servers sucks.

zTkoOEmqQ2onS8UOytQF6w.text: It's a bit ironic that their name is "Mimosas Gourmet" and yet, they do not have their liquor license so they cannot serve alcohol- let alone mimosas - at this time at least. So obviously that's a bummer.   BUUUUUTT, I was very impressed with their quality of food, cooked fast and served with a smile. Let me warn you by saying that MOST MEALS ARE ENOUGH FOR TWO PEOPLE. I had the CHURRO WAFFLE (topped with vanilla bean ice cream, powdered sugar, cinnamon, syrup and butter in the side) it wa so good and made fresh. I also ordered the breakfast TORTA. It was all so delicious!! I loved my breakfast sandwich, they forgot to add the Avocado, but that's ok - the chillies were absolutely tasteful - I warn you though - the sandwich IS SPICEY - it's not overwhelming if you enjoy spicy food - but opt out if you can't handle a kick.   My server was friendly and accommodating. For a Saturday morning it was not crowded or loud inside. I was completely satisfied with this meal! Minus the alcoholic beverages. Definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just a lonely egg sunny side up!
Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potatoes were a bit salty but still so good! (Breakfast torta)
Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Torta : ham, egg, bacon, jalepenos, chillies, avocado, Swiss cheese on chinstrap bread. The best! Enough for two.

xjZF5u2olwwrycZo1xVTpg.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Vegas!!!! Literally qualified to be on strip, but that would take away from me getting a table faster and having that personal experience with everyone there. I absolutely love this place.

118EOGn9a8tO53_dRhBCRQ.text: Nutella crepes for the win! The staff was friendly & the atmosphere is fun & live! Great brunch spot

9ZPMZ09iMnBIyXT0DxwyIQ.text: My new fav brekky spot  Mimosas in all the flavors of the rainbow . Crab /avo benedict is the best benny I have had to date . Pancakes were ginormous !!  Big plus that this is a family business and you can really tell that everyone who works there really cares . Love to support a locally  owned business .

k_P5DMvjDEARDi0TbGpglw.text: Excellent brunch spot! Service and food/drinks were great. Large portions, enough for takeaway. I'll definitely be back!!!

_msUoPqRcwoNES1x-fgypg.text: Our first experience yesterday was perfect. The staff was friendly, patient, and very accommodating. The menu is very diverse and has many options for every type of vegetarian or carnivore. Their super mimosas are wonderfully delicious with many choices of juice. The food was hot, quick, and tastefully filling. "Yummers"!!   We came in for a second time the next morning. The staff remembered us, and was super gracious about our substitutions while ordering. There was a minor mistake to one of our orders, however they went above and beyond to make it right. If we could give a higher rating than five stars, they would get it!

HQK-fCA2GxcqU9K3LL-gpg.text: Great food- great service. The mimosas are good sized, and the food was fast and delicious. Highly recommend the club sandwich.

Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Club sandwich and quesadilla.

uHaeT8ZTF6AGnHpSm3RqZA.text: Tried this restaurant today for the first time. We tried their breakfast. The service is off the charts amazing.  Drinks stayed full.  Food was very hot when it came out.  The entire place was super clean too.  Love that!!   The food was sooo good!  Flavorful and steaming hot. Large portions.  Took some home.  Will definitely go back!!

9SjbNseO4iJwgiGwLm211w.text: This place was amazing. Service was excellent and friendly. We were sat at a nice corner table right away. It's not a quite, slow paced place. All the food was delicious and prepared perfectly. Will be a favorite spot.

A29IRHtdTgi9dlppzIJvuQ.text: Excellent service. Bilingual staff. So very polite and nice staff. Food is great. Drinks delicious. Prices average just about any other good place. Will definitely come back. Make it there before 10 am or you'll be waiting in line. Good sign though. Always go where people are waiting to be seated.

sNPd2DDcjiMVqUeSpmhbGw.text: Went for birthday breakfast with friends, what a great experience! Everyone was friendly and helpful, the food was delicious and fresh. The menu has a large variety and this staff knows how to treat their customers.  Thank you Giovanni and Carlos for making our Birthday Breakfast the most memorable one we have ever had. We will definitely be back!  Can't wait till the Raiders come to Las Vegas, I hope you have a special Raiders fan breakfast item on the menu!

RzHRoEPX8tzT0qgXIHuYEQ.text: What a great place!  My wife and I came in for brunch and once they found out it was our anniversary, they gave us a huge dessert!  Very appreciated surprise!  Valerie and the staff are so warm and friendly!!!  Highly recommend and will definitely return.

t9jn3ByZnWdY3rG4Wvjd6Q.text: Love the purple booths and happy kind people, great music, have not even tasted the food yet! So happy my Kalina 17 picked this yumminess.  I have a premonition this food is going to rock my food porn requirements

W4ck5gg4qxjDzw0hV1PnuQ.text: Visiting from out of town and wanted to try an off the strip breakfast place. But the catch?! We were looking for breakfast at 1pm. Oops! Typical Vegas tourists!   This restaurant was great bec they had plenty of breakfast options and lunch options!   One funny drawback? Even though they are called Mimosas, they do not serve alcohol. No alcohol license yet. BUT, they do allow you to bring in alcohol from the grocery store next door, and create your own alcoholic drinks!  The staff was incredible friendly and attentive!  We ordered the burger and huevos rancheros. The meat for the burger was not very good. Pretty dry, and just poor quality. However, the sweet potato fries that come with it were amazing!!!  The huevos rancheros were good. Not amazing, but good.   The decor inside is a bit odd. I think perhaps since they are still new, they are still transitioning into their decor. Seemed a bit unfinished inside.   Overall, we left nice and full and this restaurant satisfied our 1pm breakfast cravings!

photos.caption: Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos rancheros and burger
Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch burger and huevos rancheros! Yum!!

CdQXmboF2FIwIFvl-nQ7QQ.text: Family owned business with great food and service. The portions are huge so be prepared. The biscuits are a must. They are huge and fluffy and amazing with jam. The southern scramble is intense- good but could have fed me for days. You need to order a pancake! Delicious! Perfectly fluffy. They do not have their liquor license yet but you can bring your own.

Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy good. The portions are huge and delicious.

pnZkHME7HVYwZqNHpZT_QA.text: Sooooo YUMMY!!!! Off the strip but so worth it. Only a 10-15 minute drive strip. Staff is very friendly. Mimosas are very very good. A split is used for every mimosa. Variety of flavors!  Definitely a MUST TRY!

5R5EWqc8HODRHhoy29vm-w.text: My friends and I choose this place since I've never been and only heard great things. There were going to be 4 people altogether. We were the first 2 there, we saw the sign that said the whole party had to be present before being sat so we asked and the hostess said it was ok and sat us immediately. She was very efficient with giving waters but that was it . We sat there watching the server help everyone else but us. I thought maybe they were not getting our food order since our whole group wasn't sat but that was only a guess, because no one else came to talk to us! We never had a server ask if we wanted drinks or even ask when the rest of our group was joining. We were dismissed. A group of 3 were sat about 15 min later and we said if they are helped before us we will leave . Well, they were approached by the server within 2 min so we left.

J1qdkMlRI8_WhL73UNJeBg.text: Mimosas lives up to its name. 1/2 of their mason jar mango mimosa and I could feel it. Delicious nonetheless!  Visited here on a Sunday Morning at 9:30. I called ahead for reservations BUT I was surprised to know that I didn't need them. Perhaps this is still a hidden gem-- definitely not in an area you would think to have brunch at. Anyway, YES you can make reservations, unlike several other brunch places, is a really nice service.   They have a little set up for coffee outside which is SO nice of them-- free coffee while you wait.  Their menu is vast! So many good things to try. Portions are comparable to Hash House-- shareable and humungo!   I had the crab/shrimp omelette covered in hollandaise with a side of hash browns and a pancake. It was really good. My friend had the fried chicken benedict- our server gave her the option of two sauces which was really cool (gravy and hollandaise).   Service is quick, efficient, and very friendly. If you check in you get a free coffee with refills.   I'll definitely come back and I hope this place picks up momentum because it's definitely a must eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab and shrimp omelette with hash browns in the foreground. Background is fried chicken Benedict
Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My side of pancake

dbAdud1mkIJiXSm3FnMc6g.text: Love this place. Great food, great staff, excellent mimosas, very loud and fun! Prepare to leave stuffed, buzzed and happy!

mHCiozKffaigMqHDvpjAow.text: I advise to make a reservation on the app ahead of time. It tells your your spot in line. The fried chicken Benedict was amazing and we asked for hollandaise/gravy (you can taste test it before, but I recommend both)! The super mimosas were a lot to handle, but the four of us finished them so I know anyone can! Chilaquiles was DELICIOUS according to my friend, too! They are very accommodating to everything you ask for! I will be back every time I visit Vegas

I had 2 sunny side up with home made potato, some French toast (choice of white, sourdough, wheat), we ordered that huge pancake for the little one (size of a dinner plate) and my friend had an omelette with potato The portion was generous (could feed 2)  We had coffee and regular mimosa Great place for breakfast! Bu1Utqxa9dUK2es-xX1kpw.text: The best mimosas and micheladas! The food is incredible and definitely tastes home made. I recommend the biscuits and gravy with a strawberry mimosa (or two... or three). The only reason I wouldn't give 5 stars is because the service wasn't that great. Our waitress took soooo long to come take our order and it was only my fiance and I and two other couples in the restaurant.

vnJiVPdeQCPvtWjMr6yVXw.text: Came in on a weekday, establishment is kept clean. Well maintained, the staff are friendly and quick to get to you. Mimosa here are great, the big option may not be the best for the price since youre paying for just one bottle. Food is amazing, will come again.

oIZ-54OPCCllwB51mX_b5g.text: Although this restaurant doesn't offer bottomless mimosas, their mimosas are so good! So far I have tried their strawberry, pineapple, mango, & watermelon. All of them were a perfect balance of flavors and I want to try them all! (Maybe someday I'll order the Super Mimosas if my friends are down!)  Their food portions are fairly large, which makes the price worth it! If you have the chance to try their homemade biscuits, please order it! It's HUGE but great when served warm!   On top of everything, the staff are super friendly! They truly care about providing good service and want to make sure you have a good time!

h92TW0FFF7KL97ed0bbVZw.text: Mimosa Gourmet is a nice breakfast/brunch spot with a wide variety for your drink selection, so you wont get bored with choices. I mainly came for the food, but I did order a prickly pear mimosa since you know, that's what you do at a restaurant with Mimosa in the name. I think if you enjoy champagne, then I say go for it. The drink and I weren't really vibing well, so I got a pina colada instead and that was really good, nice and refreshing and not super sweet.   Now the food, I was very excited to try the food because i love breakfast and the menu looked amazing. I order the bananas foster French toast which was pretty much like desert since it came with vanilla ice cream. The French toast was good but the flavor was a little underwhelming. I was expecting a bit more spice.

yvuVbDvTdjPqfZl3xg3HjA.text: Great place I went for the giant mimosas they are only 34.99 The food is really good though we had the waffle combo and the French toast combo with added sides of hash browns and potatoes. It's not pricey and you get good portions sizes.

P4F9OSY0dMlu_9QvqDJP4w.text: Stopped by for brunch on Saturday around 9am. No wait, which was nice and the server was very attentive. I ordered the skinny omelette and my boyfriend got the croissant sandwich. HUGE portions and very good food. Hash browns were so so. will come back to try the mimosas.

y3ywjvGQRHMKcU6lZopXYw.text: How could you pass up a restaurant that serves you a GIANT mimosa?! My group of 3 shared the pomegranate mimosa and it was delicious and definitely enough for the group. It makes it fun and silly to drink this with the squiggly long straws.   Now onto the food: our group always likes to get a little bit of everything and share -the corned beef is homemade and super delicious and tender. The potatoes are perfectly cooked and seasoned. -the nutella french toast was scrumptious and ooey gooey withe melted marshmallow mixed with the nutella and was the perfect sweet to the salty corned beef. I'm definitely getting this combo next time I go.  -the biscuits and gravy were tasty. It is a huge portion. I think I would've liked it more with chunks of sausage in the gravy and a little less sage.   This is a great restaurant. The staff is very friendly and makes you feel at home and the food comes out super fast. There wasn't a wait on a Sunday either.

urtAy7eLAl1A-r27KfNQ7g.text: Got the fried chicken Benedict and chili verde and eggs.  The hollandaise on the Benedict was bland and pretty sure is was made from powder instead of from scratch, and the eggs on the Benedict were over cooked.  The chili verde was very good and the beans were delicious, but the tortillas looked store bought and for the reviews I saw I expected more effort on their part.    Overall the food was decent for the cost, but not extraordinary as some reviews might insinuate.

0M91oJ8Q-2l0Ew6Mznf_zA.text: Food was really good but music was a little too loud, should be background noise. Otherwise great experience

Pvpjwq9KW-PPjVtpmDvg8Q.text: The Nutella French Toast is a MUST! Mimosas Gourmet is perfect for brunch, everyone is super friendly and the food hits you just right. I will be back very soon!

Lr_bkD6R7mwwQL5_DRYP3g.text: Amazing place to eat. I ordered the churro waffle, which was spectacular. Great portions served here. The only issue was that there were no champagne for mimosas, due to these guys not having their liquor license yet. My wife asked could we bring our own liquor in, and the waitress said yes. So a 5 star went down to a 4, and quickly shot back up to a 5. Enjoy!!!

BP8EX0ctZMYmD12EkRR1cQ.text: Went here for Easter breakfast with friends and we couldn't decide what to order because everything looked and smelled so delicious. We ended up trying 3 mimosas, peach, mango and strawberry and they were all great. The food was amazing and the portions are huge. Can't wait to go back and try some more things off the menu, and of course more mimosas

C3qo_7i_UeHQDxeNuTvFAg.text: When you walk in your introduced by vibrant colors and good vibes. The food was great and good portions. At first we saw the prices and thought this could be overpriced but after seeing portions it makes sense and we didn't overspend. The coffee cups are big and always being refilled by the friendly staff. Overall I think this place will be a number one breakfast place choice for locals. We will be back to see the growth, changes and mimosas! Only thing we found is the music choice should be more suitable for all and bathrooms need to be cleaned.

bGiweUjra8AuIRiunOKMLA.text: What a suprisingly delicious spot! The biscuits are fresh and fluffy, the gravy was grubbin and the French Toast someone nearby ordered looked like a birthday cake! Try it when you get a chance! The decor is simple, but seems to be a good, clean, family run restaurant.

zllH5vOVGn9XHVSZ6FzyFQ.text: This restaurant no long has its liquor license, or maybe it never had one to begin with but my family & I dined there today and no liquor was being served.  Upon our entrance to the restaurant there was no one to greet us at the door. After waiting nearly 5 minutes we sat ourselves at a booth next to the front door.  We waited another 10 minutes before we were finally greeted by a server who wiped down the table & brought menus. She apologized for the wait, walked a way, and eventually returned to take our orders.  It took nearly 45 mins to receive our food! My order came out incorrect (short stack with a side of hash browns & bacon) so I told the waitress what I actually ordered. She walked away, only to return with the same plate less the eggs. I repeated, once again, what I ordered. She shook her head and proceeded to tell me what the waitress rang in. I let her know I didn't order that and would like the mistake corrected. She walked away & finally came back with the proper sides.  At that point I was no longer interested in the meal. I had a bite to eat off of my husbands plate & was finished with breakfast entirely. The food was pretty descent, but definitely not worth a nearly 2 hour wait start to finish. Needless to say we won't be returning.

Wp97AtvCGGOj6N-n67ojFg.text: This is my new brunch place! They don't have their liquor license yet, but when they do, there will be a line. I had Huevos Rancheros; it was absolutely perfect! They use pinto beans and they are full of flavor, they really stand out. The hash browns are Dennys type and we all know that is our fave and they do them better than Dennys. My bestie had the French Toast with scrambled and bacon. Bacon crispy and big slices. Absolutely worth the price. Their shining star is the fresh squeezed orange juice, not one pulp in sight!. When they do get their license, their Mimosa's will be out of this world. I'll be back next week to try something else. My only suggestion would be to do the Huevos in a skillet; I like to get the eggs sunny side up on top and let that yolk sink in. Love this place! The service is perfect as well.

xhPWJXw6MAD7ZLDMx6Rk_w.text: Wonderful authentic food! The berry berry French toast was fantastic, and the chilaquiles were yummy too! Will definitely eat here again! Service was exceptional too!

Fax5ZsWiJlq3HUBdPB5pAw.text: The food and service is excellent here. One of the best breakfast places in town. I always get their Benedicts and have also tried Huevos Rancheros and Corn Beef Hash. It is well made and always hot when u get it. We love this place! Please support these neighborhood family restaurants!

sw6CrJd-UZ_Kq1dFwwekzQ.text: Great food. It is all that I have to say.  Next visit to Vegas I'll be back with my family and friends to this restaurant .   I almost forgot to mention the good customer service and super clean place.

Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos rancheros

S0XS2upL9d1UHeWyLW9_xQ.text: This is a cute little breakfast spot. I have to say - for mimosa being in their name I don't think mimosas are their specialty. I have had far better mimosas in my day. However, that doesn't discount their ranking as a breakfast hot spot. Alcohol aside, I really liked many things while dining here. The atmosphere is good, there was no wait to be seated, the staff is friendly, and the food is decent. I personally wouldn't recommend the breakfast quesadilla - but I think that is because I have been highly spoiled in the Mexican breakfast delicacy department. My boyfriend's Southern Scramble was delicious but I think it should be under the benedict portion of the menu - if only because of the confusion of not getting toast. The part of the menu it is under now states that toast comes with the meal, sub pancakes for some change. However, when you tell them you want either toast or a pancake they will inform you that the item is in the wrong section and that because it comes with a biscuit it doesn't come with any of the sides the other items in the same section do. If I came back here I would try a benedict or a traditional breakfast - I get the feeling that's what they are really good at.

photos.caption: Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Southern Scramble

dyfEtiFJ5u6Eth7P63PTUA.text: I love their fajita eggs Benedict. The girls working are always friendly and fast with their service. It's always quick and easy to get in and out for lunch on the weekdays.

z-3cDCnVJG1Aw6sEwLEXAw.text: My family and I ordered this via uber eats while in vegas, and it did not disappoint, I had the crab and prawn benny which was amazing, my mom loved her corned beef hash... my sister has the crab omelette. She said it was filled with seafood and she loved it. Last but not least my niece who doesn't finish her food ever had the nuttela waffle and didn't even leave a crumb so 10 stars to you!

GCl_g_L8i6LHl2pM1jaNHA.text: Wanted to give this place 5 stars, but here is why only 3. First a place is called Mimosa, and they don't have there alcohol license so no mimosas. Got seated and the service was VERY slow.  My hubby had the corn beef skillet, amazing. I had the chili Verde omelet, amazing. Kids had the mini pancakes bacon and eggs, which they split cause they get 6 mini pancakes. Food was amazing, so sad to see a place with amazing tasty food but awful service. Looks like it's under staff and not to mention they missed things from our order which we never got, then tried to charge me which she ended taking off. Hopefully they read these comments and make changes such great potential.

UAUVGVRY6HNExXlfaPILUQ.text: Lovely little piece of France! The owner was so nice and took the time to talk to us truly making us feel welcome. The food was delicious and the coffee tasted just as it does in Europe. Favorite new spot!

VfoT_AwM5U2IxN0Xg3pzcA.text: Great food!  Chili Verde breakfast and the waffle breakfast were great!  The service was fast and excellent.  Will definitely go back!

zlYWdtdJ5bgaYCgyK3UbeA.text: This place was pretty awesome! The vibe was very upbeat, the music was pretty loud for breakfast but I loved it! They were playing some edm which really made me wanna party and have a mimosa ^.^ which they have a very nice selection of different flavors and even a giant mimosa which uses the whole bottle of champagne! VyAkNbdFtszZHhUSKfqjAQ.text: Great food and reasonable prices. I had the hash and eggs and it was a home made hash. Really tasty. My wife had the chocolate chip pancakes and they were really good as well. Service good. It's a little to hard to find but worth looking for

0TWDRhocJFrPLhfzmTrWpA.text: Tucked in an obscure strip mall behind an Arby's and a Dunkin Donuts sits Mimosas Gourmet.   The owner has created an amazing diamond in the rough.  Half of the buildings in this strip mall are vacant, belying the literal amazingness in a glass in this brunch spot. The owner sports a T-shirt that touts brunch was invented so you could have mimosas. She darts about the place all of about 5 feet( even standing on a stool at one point to work the register). But her imprint looms much larger. Her team ( which includes at least one daughter) works within a choreographed efficiency that indicates years of matriarchal deference. And her instincts are spot on. The food was solid. My corned beef hash was not from a can. It was embodied with delicious and tender corned beef, plenty of red potatoes and a smattering of red onions and green peppers. Two eggs perfectly cooked over medium topped this mound of yumminess. A massive house made biscuit accompanied. Hubster had the California Benedict, which he could not finish. The Benedict looked amazing. The Hollandaise was a bit on the cheesier side than I preferred, but Hubster did not seem to mind at all. Can we talk about the Mimosas?  Freshly squeezed orange juice. 'Nuf said. Generally my only requisite for a five-star mimosa.  But when you name something after a drink, you'd better do a good job. The flavors!  So many. Including the benign alternatives like pineapple or mango. This place offers Prickly Pear, Mango, and Watermelon.  Just Go!

5c0c52BdxaytDPupRUlbMw.text: They made our morning! It is my son Jarett's 21st Birthday and he accepted the challenge to drink their mega mimosa in 30 minutes. He concurred it with 6+ minutes left. Then they surprised him with tequila shots oh my Their breakfast portions are large and great. They have something for everyone . We'll be back, a must for everyone

photos.caption: Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TJbdapX2FZFWVBZETh1lww.text: Highly recommended post-show place!!! They treat you well and feed you some good stuff. Shared two mimosas between a group of 7 and everyone had enough for seconds in giant cups! (Honestly it was probably overkill but why not )   Service was on point, had two servers at our table basically with how attentive they were lol.   Very large portions! Highly recommend sharing. They also have this amaziiiiing crab and shrimp po-boy and it was just WOW.

flp5NL_NIF8TEtQROsMIwA.text: Critical...YES, they have Mimosas (with champagne!)  Popped in here with a girlfriend kinda late on a Sunday morning and thoroughly enjoyed it.     Easy-going, not pretentious, "brunch" place with a TV or two to entertain sports fans.   Would be good for families....parents deserve brunch too, darn-it!  Food was yummy enough that I'll definitely go back, but the pancakes and lychee mimosa are REALLY why I'll be back!!!     Large portions and definitely above greasy spoon diner status but not so bougie that you need to throw on full makeup and hair.  Yoga pants will do (plus you'll want the stretch!!).    Prices are reasonable.    I had the Benedict with steak & avocado (can't remember what it was called, but it was waitress-recommended) and it was fabulous & very filling (took home half).  My BFF had the chicken and waffles.  We're from the south, so obvi we've had better, but by Vegas standards, not too shabby.    The pancake tho was out-of-this-world good.  I don't know what you can do to pancake batter to make such a delish disc of carbs, but man, I'll be back for more!!

aq_7H8Ig98k6FnP4ZfxWJg.text: I came by this joint about a week ago. Since it was a Sunday I knew it would be busy and it was. The upside was the wait was minimal, maybe 10-15 minutes. Once our party of five was seated our server took our drink orders and they came out quickly. My friend and I sampled mimosas and my husband and another friend had beers. The mimosas were tasty, we had peach and pomegranate. Everyone agreed the pomegranate was more flavorful. Our server was very attentive and came by at the right time for our food order. When the food came out everything was correct, hot, and fresh. I had the herbed chicken skillet. The chicken was actually moist and had a great flavor to compliment the breakfast potatoes. One of my dinning companions let me try the biscuit and gravy, the biscuit was airy but thick and the gravy had the right amount of pepper. It was a great meal, the service was fast and friendly, and the food is well worth the price. Can not wait to go back!

JfuLBTQIxuajaCevQQwkdA.text: Omg the mimosas are great and so is the food! Don't get the monster mimosa unless you are sharing and super thirsty! Staff was so very nice. We will be back when we visit again!

C8Yg7f18pLRFeI6XFLgGwg.text: Being enticed by their name and loving Mimosas I thought this place was a must to visit when trying to decide on a Sunday Brunch, extremely disappointed to find that they don't have a liquor license and don't actually serve any mimosas. After reading some of the reviews i became a little curious. A review 5 months ago states they didn't have a liquor license, another review from 2 months ago she reviewed how the mimosa wasnt that great and now they have no license again?! Makes me wonder why they keep losing it. Anyways.   You seat yourself pretty much. They did greet us right away and take our order. Caution the water tastes just like water from a hose so order something else to drink. They do have lots of different juices and they did taste pretty fresh.  We ordered the chocolate chip pancakes and the strawberry waffle. The chocolate chip pancakes are HUGE! Two pancakes serves with strawberries, whipped cream and drizzled chocolate syrup. Definitely large enough to share.  The waffle was a typical size topped with fresh strawberries, whipped cream and served with a side of maple syrup and butter. The food was good. Unfortunately the fact that it took so long for it to come out was a bit of a turn off.   Overall, not a bad experience but nothing out of the ordinary or something that stands out. Maybe if they ever get a liquor license and actually sell what their name says it might be different.

z9DL3WSWfax8A8DlCkqW3g.text: Came here for brunch.   Portions are humongous. I split the fried chicken eggs benedict, and I could barely finish half of it. The eggs benedict was short of spectacular. The eggs were scrambled instead of poached wtf, and the fried chicken (breaded and fried like a katsu style) was dry. The gravy sauce on the side, however, was pretty tasty as it had hints of ginger in it.   Also tried their pancake, and it made up for the mediocre eggs benny. It was some of the best pancakes I've ever had. It was so big and fluffy, and the combination of the butter, the hot, moist, pancake, and syrup incited an orgasm in my mouf. I was smiling after every bite :)  Service was lovely, and their coffee was really good as well. I'll be back if I'm ever in the mood for those pancakes again.

iR5ab9fTAsGtI5lw0FDI6A.text: I found Mimosas Gourmet here on Yelp, and decided to try it due to the 4 1/2 star reviews it currently has.  My less than stellar 3-star review was mostly due to service.  Drinks::  we each got a mimosa, which were served in large bowl-like glasses.  They were good...not amazing, but honestly about what I expected for the price.  I think they were almost $9, and the size was equal to at least two typical sized mimosas.  The large shareable mimosas were at almost every table, and looked fun to share if you were with group.  Food::  I got the corned beef hash platter, which really was quite good.  The corned beef tasted fresh and was more like a pulled pork or a tender roast then what one typically gets with corned beef hash.  I had asked for the horseradish sauce to be on the side, and they gave me some on the side, but still put it all over my meal...so that kind of ruined the dish for me.  My boyfriend got the juevos rancheros.  He liked it, but did say it was very spicy.  He also had ordered an iced tea, which we had to ask three different times for before they brought it (at the end of our meal).  He also had ordered a side of toast that he never received.    Service::  as I mentioned above, the change request was not done correctly, and two food items were not brought to us without being repeatedly asked for.  Our waiter also never came to see how our meal was until we were done eating.  Although he was friendly, we just were not happy with the service, and likely won't return because of this.    Atmosphere::  it was a small restaurant with many tables pretty close together.  It had more of a New York crammed feeling, which isn't necessarily bad...just different than what is used to here in Vegas.  The restaurant is pretty loud and busy feeling with most people there drinking large amounts of alcohol.  Again, not bad, just definitely not a quiet place if that's what you're looking for.

NSC2zRtxUp4fh1lsesnFeA.text: Cozy cafe ambiance with a great breakfast selection. Offering a variety of healthy and local specials. Obviously known for its mimosa selections, offering over ten different flavors.   Personal experience we had a few order complications with getting the right dishes and having order issues. Sadly the recovery process was very delayed which is why I provided a lower rating.   If in Vegas and don't mind leaving the strip it's a great little spot to try out.

YZd7EADtz-xKIxusKyMaxw.text: A few of my friends recommended this place to me for brunch. After watching the video of their giant mimosa, I had to come try!!  First off, if you're coming for weekend brunch prepare to wait at least an hour! Unless you come right at open, there will be a constant line of people. Although they do have the yelp waitlist, we ended up waiting an additional hour after the check in time. I joined the yelp waitlist at 12:15 and arrived around 1:20. Upon checking in, there was 7+ parties ahead of us. While waiting, we were removed from the waitlist for some reason. Not sure if she called our name but we were standing right by the door the entire time, so probably not. Fortunately she placed us back on. We were not seated until 2:15. So long story short: the yelp waitlist will not guarantee 0 wait times.  The food was extremely underwhelming. My friend and I were EXTRA HANGRY. Usually when im super hungry anything tastes good but both our dishes left us disappointed. I got the fried chicken Benedict with hollandaise. Their hollandaise is more of a thicc flour water mixture with yellow coloring. There was no butter flavor. The chicken was cut up in small pieces and the scrambled eggs were extremely tough/hard.  Of course we had to order the giant mimosas, which is probably the one decent part of our experience. They have a variety of flavors you can mix and match to add on to your mimosa. However, I noticed the flavors are just simple syrup. I know it's harsh to judge a mimosas on flavor (I mean it's just champagne and juice..) but this mimosa was MEH. But.. our server poured an entire bottle in one glass! Pretty cool experience, but I'd rather pay $15 for bottomless at literally anywhere else. Also, most of the other brunch spots in summerlin give you fresh juice or concentrate which I find tastier to mix with. I noticed they were handing out shots to birthday people which seemed a lot of fun. They sing, dance, and take a shot with you! The servers were all kind and seemed to be having a good time.   Overall, it's pretty over hyped for brunch. I could list you so many other solid brunch spots that are NOT gimmicky and offer quality food and drink. If you want to experience the giant mimosa then go ahead, personally this is not where I would brunch ESPECIALLY if your visiting Vegas as a tourist.

-lyao56tLadYNGQQ31nG9Q.text: A great find in an unsuspecting, little shopping center! Taylor and I tried them out of convenience, but we will be back for sure:)   Mimosas may be their namesake, but they have an amazing jalapeno Bloody Mary that could be on any high end bar menu; superb quality and balanced, but SPICY! They have a full bar for all your other hair o' the dog needs.    They also have a big menu and reasonable prices. We both did the basic breakfast, and everything was tasty. Food came out super quick, even for a diner, and the staff worked as a seamless team to deliver prompt service in a busy, but modest dining room.

75AQKQBeKpj3Mo6q03TZFg.text: I've been to Mimosas 3 times now and every time it is delicious!   The restaurant isn't trendy looking or anything - it's super simple with a bunch of tables & a bar. Minimal decoration at best.   Service is ok. Often, they're a little slow coming to your table to get your order. They are quick about drinks, but to get your food order is the slow part.   The food is the real shining part of Mimosas. Everything is flavorful and HUGE portions. I can never eat all the food. I can't get over how good it is, which is what keeps me coming back even when the service isn't the fastest.   I do warn: if you come here later in the morning/early afternoon, it is super busy & you'll probably end up waiting a while. The earlier you go, the less busy it is and you can usually get seated pretty quickly.   Overall, definitely recommend! Soooo good!

f1cdRUSmjimaewtfub89-A.text: A little noisy and crowded but I did go on a Saturday afternoon around noon. You can sit at the bar with no wait but I recommend ordering something from the bar. I got the fried chicken Benedict with potatoes and my friend got eggs with sausage breakfast! Super nice people, guava mimosa was good and speedy service. I'd go back just not around lunch time!

9vMLLojMxcfzT_Bvg5Vggw.text: came by for breakfast, Saturday around 9:30AM. There was no wait for a booth, plenty of seating at tables & at the bar as well. I tried the prickly pear mimosa which was phenomenal, yummy & strong. My friend got the lychee mimosa which was OK. Kind of tasted like a green apple cider   There's already water w/ straws at your table when you arrive, as well as cups for coffee. Our service was fast, friendly, and good all day.   I got the BBLT (bacon, lettuce, tomato, extra bacon) & fries. Everything was great! The sauce was very interesting. I couldn't figure out what it was but it tasted delicious.   My friend got the traditional eggs Benedict which was yummy, especially the seasoned homemade potatoes. Fair prices, good food, great service. I will be back!

9ddXRajg2JBMGEuGfcOSww.text: Unassuming little corner spot off Durango and Desert Inn. Let me start by saying that the portion sizes are HUGE!! None of our party of 5 finished their meals. You really get a lot of food for the standard brunch prices. The food was well prepared if anything it was under seasoned (which I prefer to over seasoning) nothing a little table salt and pepper couldn't fix.    While the food is well prepared and tasty the star of this menu is the mimosa! Obviously you expect a great mimosa from a place called Mimosas Gourmet! I am happy to report that they did not disappoint!! There are several flavors to choose from and they are rather large glasses filled with more sparkling than juice. I had the Prickly Pear and Lychee and I was also able to sample a friends Pomegranate flavored mimosa. They were all delicious, but I am a sucker for prickly pear anything so that would be my top recommendation. They also have a Super Mimosa for $35 which is huge and can be split between a table of friends (I personally don't like the concept of big straws in drinks for multiple people, I would prefer to ladle out my portion into a separate glass vs swapping spit with my table mates).   I wouldn't necessarily come back just for the food but I would definitely come back to sample more mimosas and have a decent breakfast accompaniment.
