wlENHJLbfYIg6udVEWFdpg.text: This place is amazing! Seating were comfortable, great customer service, and they made what I wanted perfect. The Nutella S'mores French toast was poppin. Although I wish they minimize the Nutella on the French toast. It was little too much. But otherwise this place was awesome! If your looking for a great breakfast place to eat at, this is the great place!

nGvHt99JTNXhKqqXNmXXbw.text: Wow, never expected such delicious food.  Had the Chilaquiles with Chorizo, excellent.   Don't judge by the outside!  Our new breakfast place.

m0zxOfBl2lPHTfEvhzdzOA.text: The food was delicious with abundant servings.  I ordered an omelet and hashbrowns.  The service was good.  I'll definitely be back again to try more yummy goodness from the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Generous portions, great taste!

q0czEMizZk-T8DgVKAPcZg.text: Great place for breakfast. Big portions, wonderful flavor, GREAT coffee. Couldn't ask for a better breakfast joint for laid back delicious food. Can't wait to come back.

oIwoE-CsPh-pU-BB1WEHbQ.text: This restaurant is a great find! It has the best Mexican food I've had here in Las Vegas for a long time. And we really weren't expecting to eat Mexican food we were going there for brunch, pancakes, waffles, eggs benedict etc. We ended up ordering huevos Ranchero and Chile Verde and it was outstanding. The portions are huge and the chef does an excellent job on everything. Definitely will be going back there!

3FrYTu_W2gZn98af5A_G0A.text: Best breakfast in Vegas.  Their biscuits are fresh, fluffy, and delicious.  So far, everything is dang delicious.

BpZcpldx2grBejGaiFwzzg.text: Food was fantastic! Some of the best pancakes I've had in a long time. Great service as well! Definitely coming back.

bn97V9Xvqpnwm9ICgdmQYQ.text: Super food! The service was kind and quick. The waitress called me "mija" which I thought was endearing. Would eat breakfast every day here if I could!

_WcvbRB8yPGe_6XozRGHVg.text: Delicious breakfast and a ton of food.  Huge menu, friendly service - our first time here but will definitely be back.

t8J85-3YNKG_Xft962E-fQ.text: I ordered the chicken fried steak with eggs. The chicken fried steak was the size of a UFO from Area 51! It was leaning on a big mound the size of a softball and all of it was covered in a great white sausage gravy. The mound turned out to a huge biscuit. All of that was on one plate; the second plate had home style potatoes and two eggs. The second plate was absolutely fantastic - I can't believe how good it was. Their seasoning was perfect: I would eat that every day for the rest of my life and be happy. The eggs and potatoes disappeared and the UFO flew home in a take-out container. My dining companion ordered one thing on the menu and his food came on 3 plates! Actually, one of his plates was the size of a small table and the pancakes on it were bigger than a large Frisbee. They ended up flying out alongside the UFO in its own delivery truck. Tons of great tasting food, and it was inexpensive too. What a find!

6oHYQWWn2jddb2BpNnWGVA.text: Warm welcomes followed by great food...  Does it get any better???    No, this is not gourmet food, but it is great food!!  I can't say enough about how fresh everything seems to be.  I have been here several times and feel like I am part of a very special family of people who care about a great customer experience while taking the time to do it right.  The lox benedict are insanely good.  I would not have thought of putting cold lox on a bagel and covering with poached eggs, Hollandaise, capers and all the trimmings.  The lox are so fresh, some of the best I have had in this town.  I have taken friends and family here, including fussy foodie friends, to a person, loved by all.  I implore you don't go, I want it all to myself!!  The consummate definition of a hidden gem...

SgH0JV74aTRQkBpMBAe8Sg.text: They do not have mimosas! They told us they didn't serve alcohol because of their alcohol license however there was another table who did have a bottle and mimosas. It is not okay that they only serve it to some people. Food was good but won't come again!

KX674nqZa_1rB2AppdoIyw.text: This place sits in the strip mall behind Arby's. We went at 10am  on a Friday and were seated right away. We immediately had a lady offer us coffee and drinks and then quickly took our order as well. The menu is very diverse, and was hard to pick. Both of our dishes were delicious and had large portions. The check was $38 for two people which was a bit high, lowering just one star for this. Staff was very friendly and the place was clean!

photos.caption: Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kcNIB-ctBz4j6crBFDiMGw.text: Amazing staff, amazing food, amazing place. Came here on my birthday for brunch. I've never been to a brunch place that had amazing customer service and food. From the moment we walked in till the moment we left, I loved it. Thank you for everything. We will definitely be back and bring more people with us.

gyf5BuitzufMgBzZ2LWVPQ.text: I'm Giving This A 1 Star Establishment For Several Reasons: No Alcohol But Posted On The Menu, Decor Is Awful, The Name Of The Establishment Is False Advertising, Food Was Good, Just A Sloppy Marketing Strategy

4uBIQK45USdiIGLeexfWkg.text: You need to try the Mango mimosas! They are so good. Had the breakfast burrito and liked it.

tVy1d5WQNqNSi4Dlea8SWQ.text: I've been to this place a bunch of times and I absolutely LOVE this place! The food is delicious, service is friendly, and the restaurant has a great feel to it. Try the chilaquiles, it's SO GOOD!!!!!

b7GI-dj1BPyvRooG_n7IRw.text: Came for the mimosas and they don't have their alcohol license, yet. They also wanted to charge an additional $5 for my friend to have the berries with the french toast, which was listed as much cheaper on the menu. You would think because they cannot serve as their menu suggests that they would be more accommodating. The food was alright but will return once their full menu is available.

QuMMpuTFspcL7ymFkfn3xA.text: Friends wanted to visit this restaurant because of the name.  I'd never been here.  I ordered Potatoes with onions and Green Peppers and they were seasoned to perfection and done thoroughly.   The pancakes were big as the plate with a hint of vanilla, light fluffy & taste like heaven.  The bacon was cooked just like I requested... done, but not crisp.  I will visit here again! Service was great too, very attentive! Clean restaurant and restrooms.   More marketing needs to be given so people are aware of this great eatery.  I hope they get their liquor license soon.

mGFb_Gqq7lyBWbd_m8W5uQ.text: Under staffed, ran out of Bloody Mary mix and coronas at 11:30a and took an hour to get our food. It's safe to say we will not be returning.

XZV2wZpZuJeXJUtn7mNI6A.text: Hidden gem! My girl and I saw this place and decided to pop in for a mimosa. We had a great experience. The service was prompt, the staff was very attentive and the mimosas were amazing! We will definitely be coming back to try more items on the menu.

D0zi7-X4EedCN5Fu69D5wg.text: I had the eggs Benedict and it was amazing. You could tell the biscuit was fresh, eggs were good. I didn't care a lot for the special sauce they gave me. It honestly would've tasted great just by itself. You should definitely try, if you're wanting something different yet sort of traditional!

i5d_ORV1KBP2cSaZ9jLEQQ.text: Wow, great great service and even better food! Best kept secret in Las Vegas! The outside is not much to look at but inside very quaint the service there will make you smile.  My new favorite place to eat breakfast!!!

BLRTelTPNy65lkNKRHVW_g.text: We stumbled upon this gem tucked in a strip mall across from Desert Breeze Park. Friendly and inviting staff and delicious food! The pancake I ordered was the best pancake I've ever eaten. Coffee was great, atmosphere was nice and prices were good. Definitely will be back.

SwUxPYD-CDZxn-Xpr-Zwdg.text: Spend your money here!! Mimosas were great and food was even better. Excellent service! I live across  town but will be back due to the excellent service.

fbBg0RjJ9MoM6HurVKbamg.text: Accidentally happened upon this place a few months ago and man do we love it. Never had a bad anything: no bad food and no bad service. I love it here, have suggested it to others and have invited people to join us. We practically live at Desert Breeze Park so this is a fantastic place to grab good food, good drinks and everything else that comes with a good restaurant.

UHmCpOwjxY_xufGgW16kVw.text: Late review came here Sunday, March 18th. Visting from Redondo Beach, CA. First time here, we will definitely be back. Food was delicious. Staff was super friendly!!! Had the Huevos rancheros with the potatoes it was Amazing! Chorizo and eggs, were delicious the kids had pancakes and they were the bomb! Coffee and Hot chocolate were Delish! The only thing is we found this place on our last day in Vegas :(  Sorry forgot to take pics of the food. We found our go-to spot for breakfast when we come to Vegas!  I've already told all my friends about this place...can't wait to come back!

qs4Nzd0kNqmzkFS3ijn8ww.text: The best way to start a Sunday. Friendly staff and amazing mimosas!! One my favorites now.

9Qka6rzBf4nkZp3f_DRoGg.text: A good place to go get mimosas and brunch. Very unassuming exterior that leads to friendly waitstaff and tasty breakfast entrees with interesting mimosas.

EBU3wuclnqGf32yPAy5ImA.text: Good service and wonderful food . I loved the corn beef hash and the pancake that I ordered . My cousin got the steak omelet and she said it was good . I like the fact it's family owned and I was greeted as soon as I walked in the door . I can't wait until they get there liquor license so I can actually have a mimosas . But it's nice to know that they allow  you for the time being to bring your own champagne for your mimosas .

photos.caption: Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My special request on the pancake rather than getting the strawberries inside the pancake I wanted them on top . It was no problem at all .
Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef hash made from scratch ... it was so good .

fVOcLoFoOApEr-YzEqHNXw.text: Yummy with huge portions! Never disappointed in flavor, portions or presentation.  Large selections of huge Mimosas seals the deadly.  A definite must have!

G3DYQZiNnib4ey9wzEX6oA.text: I came to try this restaurant after reading the yelp reviews and I was not disappointed. Delicious food at a great price. The portion sizes are huge and the staff is so friendly. I will definitely make this a regular brunch spot for my family.

zQnzLGCdzRoyxv534MlqFA.text: Don't go here if you are expecting a mimosa anytime soon. The name is misleading and so are the pictures on Yelp. They are currently in the process of applying for a liquor license... we just went 30 minutes out of our way and left. Even there website says they serve mimosas! Horrible communication.

w0BXmPldNRe41scFlhye9g.text: I was a little apprehensive at trying this place at first but once I tried to food I must say this is a great place for breakfast or lunch. Had a BBLT and quality of food is fantastic as well as great service. Will for sure be back.

0FzgtCiOy16X02m-2DgQPQ.text: Had breakfast here on Monday at 9AM.  We had the chicken fried steak. Best I've had in a long time!!! It wasn't mealy or flour tasting, it was crisp outside and juicy inside!  The gravy was exceptional wth sausage and Rosemary!  We had the biggest biscuit I've seen in awhile.  I wouldn't call it a biscuit as it taste like a cross of a good biscuit and a really good dinner roll.  Need lots of butter and Jam!  Hash browns and eggs cooked perfectly!  We r going back to try other things on the menu.   Clean, friendly and fast service! Right now I say it's a hidden gem for breakfast!  Let's see how my next visit/review goes!  Did I mention I like my food served hot?  And this was straight off the grill!

Wjhfn9FWMRRZwMNAiVUxlw.text: I was nervous about getting a burger from a breakfast place but I was pleasantly surprised. The burger was huge, juicy, and definitely "dinner" quality. My girlfriend had a huge French toast with berries and whipped cream that she loved too.

7xe4sHWghf8Na16Kzl0WWQ.text: This place is a bit off the beaten path (in my opinion) but is worth it! The food is very good and the portions are big. I was a bit disappointed that they didn't have their liquor license, as I was looking forward to a mimosa!

JCT081EwU649E8HXTEW9bg.text: Breakfast was really good.  We were visiting out of town and met family there for breakfast.  The Irish Eggs Benedict was very flavorful.  The portions are very large so if you aren't a big eater, you could easily split a meal.  We had the mimosa and the prickly pear mimosa which was delicious.  The prices are very reasonable considering portion size as well.  Also they are very generous with the mimosa as well.  The only reason I am rating a four star is the music is extremely loud.  It is very difficult to have a conversation and our waitress was kind enough to turn it down.  However one of her coworkers turned it back up.  Otherwise, our waitress was very good and overall a nice breakfast and drinks.

HrRc6gkBrnhpGG5iDHHbDg.text: There are just days away from their liquor license !  Family owned & operated.  Food is fresh & delicious.  This is my second time here and their omelets are amazing!!   Try the side pancake for $1 add on - it's amazing!!  Steak Omelet is fantastic.   If your looking for a  breakfast /brunch place - definitely put this on your list !!

hUy43sdAIpVOdPdNR9ircw.text: EGGS BENEDICT is off the chain. Also, the plate comes with the best hash browns. Ever had hash brown that was soggy or soft with no crisp? Well this is the opposite, super crisp and in huge proportion. Hollandaise heaven, service was superb and quick. LOVE.

ZeaSH7fDJreSGsMW_o4k-w.text: We had guests in town and had previously raved about the food so we ordered takeout.  One of the dishes we had was the shrimp and crab omelet and there was a half an egg shell in her omelet.  Large pieces.  And a piece of foil.  Gross.  Very disappointed.  We won't be returning or referring out of town guests.  Sad.

3NHFuxbwNIwTRkxLq44p5g.text: Wonderful, homemade American and Mexican food. Everything from the Nutella waffles and French toast to the chile verde plate and eggs Benedict so many ways is scrumptious. For my youngest son's wedding breakfast 23 family members and guests ordered off the menu, including the mimosas and Bloody Mary's. The biscuits and gravy alone could feed three people. Owners, Yusay and Lermin Ibarra, we're so gracious and laughed and joked along with the party, while serving delicious food. Mimosas Gourmet is a local treasure. This is now one of my favorite haunts!

B1fj_vjk_Cz71bRNUN0Mrg.text: Best breakfast and lunch in Vegas!!! Excellent food and service!  The chef and owner does a great job in putting out a fantastic meal, he puts a lot of love into his restaurant.  Keep up the great work, I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nFlHiPqLZ0LltEJ--hJ_1A.text: Well worth the drive from the strip. Nice twist on traditional dishes. The mimosas were something else Lychee was my favorite. Fun and helpful servers.

A-SVoca-ptjQMhF0OW_sbw.text: The good:  -Pancakes are amazing. Huge, fluffy, light, probably the best I ever had.  The bad: -As other reviews say, they don't serve mimosas. WTF?! Completely disappointed with this. That's the entire reason I came here. Didn't think I had to check if they sell mimosas at a place called MIMOSAS GOURMET. Either get your liquor license or change the name. Come on now... -Waitress was inattentive, didn't check up on us, and walked away when I was ordering an orange juice literally mid-sentence.  -Because she was so inattentive... I ordered chocolate chip pancakes. I received plain. - We ordered chilaqueles with sour cream on the side and no onion. We got chilaqueles with sour cream and onion all mixed in. Urgh!  Get mimosas on the menu, have the elder server pay attention, and don't get everyone's orders wrong and I would come back.

oohnE8KqFyJNb77xrUvOMQ.text: OMG!!!!!!!! This place is a GEM!!! I love visiting different breakfast restaurants in Vegas and this one by far has been the best! Service is excellent, these employees make you feel special. The chilaquiles (not sure if that's how you spell it) but dam they were BOMB!

photos.caption: Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A+

iU-uwyQgjGH_YV7lH5FcfQ.text: This hidden gem is tucked away behind Arby's on Durango just south of Desert Inn. We just had brunch and the food and service were both excellent. It is a family business and they genuinely put their heart into it. Came away rooting for them to be very successful. Please support them as it is well worth it.

h3z4H4CDfcx8FtjKEe6PCA.text: Because of my desire to sleep in, they were able to deliver breakfast straight to my hotel! The food was absolutely delicious and plentiful. I would recommend highly, especially for breakfast.

6H8kaEXB5nexvpPTfRLAhw.text: Saw this place on yelp and was really excited to try it out. Arrived at the restaurant and was immediately greeted and sat at a table. The business was pretty slow. No more than 4 tables (including the one I was at) was being served. Ordered shortly after arriving and waited for our food for approx 30-45 min. Why does the service take so long if the restaurant isn't packed? Once our order finally arrives to our table I find that it has green onions on my meat lovers skillet which I very specifically did not want and double checked with our server, Alex. After telling him how disappointed we were with the experience, being it was our first time, he apologized and left. Then someone from the kitchen wearing a hairnet comes out to our table attempting to take my plate saying she's gunna remake my order so it's correct. She was extremely argumentative and abrasive. I would stay away from this establishment at all costs. Unless you like being yelled at and intimidated. Only reason I gave two stars was the fact that we were immediately greeted and sat upon arrival.

MZyUCMqrYBGHWlzlhJa0jA.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE. amazing food, amazing mimosas, AMAZING staff. This will definitely be a weekly visit for my friends and me. Thank you everyone at Mimosas Gourmet!!!

wxRIfyGH3dQw813HDKjksw.text: Everything was slightly off. Over medium eggs were under cooked. Country scrambled eggs were not cooked properly. Had to request new cup and silverware as the ones placed on the table were dirty. Food was served lukewarm. Perhaps most disappointing, we went to mimosas for brunch, they had an extensive bar menu, but no liquor license!

VGRhqHls8-FW79JLzi8-5Q.text: Delicious. When we visited last Spring break we stopped here for breakfast. A little way out from the Strip but worth the drive. We didnt get to try the Mimosa's due to alcohol license but hopefully they have the Mimosa's now. We will forsure be back.

YDbmCAr6KNoJOTXRPqIFGQ.text: We never actually ate here so feeling under the weather we wanted breakfast delivered and we ordered and were very satisfied how easy and good the food was! We'll go back and dine in soon

bRwXRjmWv49a1uOOweJ0vw.text: The best breakfast, ever. Hands down. Delicious!!    We went to this liitle place three times this week, and had top notch food, as well as great service, each time! The skillets are amazing, and their in house corned beef hash was simply delicious.  If you are going to Vegas, this place is well worth the drive off of the strip!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mimosas Gourmet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gJIirqlKd-1-iMTSzoU3Ag.text: warning:no mimosas,.. yet. they are working on license but food and portions are delishhhhh.   let's work on that license:)

nALzprXvjRBlpsPzxwUmPQ.text: Clean restaurant with diverse breakfast and lunch menu, great food, and good service.  Reasonable prices, don't be turned off by odd location in an empty lot.   Nice whiff of fresh home cooked food when you enter this new Las Vegas gem.

BszqfAWF7rGCc-WXile9ow.text: This place is great.  Great customer service, great food.. the biscuit was HUGE! Jalapeno potatoes  we will for sure be back.

TATvZuNdZAK5HgY0T6Zsbg.text: Great food, great service!  Looking for something better than hash house, this is the place.  Flavored mimosas, try the lychee mimosa.  I had the biscuits and gravy, with rosemary, so delicious!

Cf_zUC3gJoVW45FHSWg9oA.text: Food was great, service was exceptional. It is tough to find a quality breakfast spot that gets your order right, THE FIRST TIME! The vibe was chill and the music selection was on point. This is definitely a place I will be returning to, when I am in need of some really good breakfast.

SqMUVeuO6p-tII8zXAeuOA.text: Wow!!! Such an amazing experience here. The food was amazing, and the portions are humongous it was so phenomenal. The staff was so great and so welcoming it really made all the difference. I was so happy to be there and they just did such an amazing job. It looks small but inside is a lot larger than it looks from outside. So grateful! Will definitely be back again and recommend all my friends to go !!!!

wtb816hzrB7LB7d831u2IA.text: Best spot for breakfast and mimosas . They have the best service. It's family owned and super nice ppl. They were super funny and made it so much fun for us . They even came out and sang happy birthday with patron shot (all on the house ) I tried their pomegranate mimosa and it was delicious. I can't complain about the food . It was super good . I had the scramble de chorizo with hash browns. Totally recommend this place.

1l8FjEZCrUWj9wEhraRwdg.text: This place is great. Great size portions and yummy food. One of our new favorite breakfast stops. Their biscuit and gravy dish is super. And the size of the biscuit are incredible.

n8BVdlR_sZx5sf-W2LBg8Q.text: I love this restaurant. The most friendly people. The food is great. You will never go home hungry, everything is so big. Next time you're close and hungry, try it.

cGA3VEdaUAribGfh4_mkXw.text: Ordered from UberEATS this morning and so happy we tried this place. We had a veggie skillet, corned beef hash and eggs, banana caramel waffle and Nutella French toast. There was plenty of food and it was full of flavor. I'm a foodie and this is definitely tasty food. Can't wait to try sit down service, hopefully it's even better fresh from the kitchen to the table.

tsgLmCPw0dw0ilxGRJ5WDA.text: My whole family enjoyed their breakfast selection, including my hard-to-please son found his French toast to be "the best ever," and my husband's Diablo skillet was the right amount of heat and flavor. I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because their liquor license was temporarily suspended, so none of those delicious-looking mimosas for me.

rm_wmtPfr06xSr8X4_70Sg.text: We were so disappointed as they do not, repeat do not, sell mimosas or any other alcohol. Apparently there some kind of liquor license issue, and they say it's posted on the website. But, I didn't see it when I read through their menu of mimosas on their website. Food was generous and good, but service was slow. It was disappointing as we really wanted to have drinks at our branch. I doubt we'll be back.

zJpB0L0N0SBCafAbHU4XFg.text: Food is delicious, clean and clearly gourmet! Delicious and something on the menu for every taste palette! Loved it!

ASfVqzGm2RdemhQAeagUfg.text: This place has the potential to be an amazing brunch place. The food is phenomenal.   We got 4 different entrees the corn beef hash. It was delicious but I wish they served it with something other than hash browns because there's already potatoes in the hash, but other wise delicious. The Nutella marshmallow French toast was to die for. Bring a tooth brush because this has enough sugar for the entire year. I recommend sharing this one. The steak skillet and the chorizo omelette were also full of flavor.   The service, this is where they lost stars. Our waitress threatened us before we ordered so that was really a damper on our meal. We ordered four mimosas which is the name of the establishment. After 3 came out they told me they couldn't make the watermelon one because it would take too long. I was staring at the watermelon on the counter and just ordered a different one because from the beginning our waitress was rude. This mimosa never came and I decided not to bother. They obviously charged us for it but were really nice and apologized for it. I really wish I had a mimosa though.   All in all an interesting experience, probably won't go back because I don't like to be served by rude people. But the food might tempt me to go back. I really want to try the churro waffle (this is a note to self)

Lz8qVKeo0jnScl0TJH9F6Q.text: Great service great drinks and good food! I had the bacon and chicken waffle. No complaints doc the job and staff was attentive

-CCTXfW_j9VJQBRsNr-l1Q.text: Excellent food!  Big portions...enough to share.  Clean atmosphere and friendly staff.  Can't wait to try something different.  The Chile verde omelette was phenomenal.

14UwRMdgUwosEfmRLhza6g.text: Food was good, I think they will do fine here, clean atmosphere and the service was great

7P3fa3eklHBbNRqDhM2_eQ.text: Found this hidden little spot while looking for a new brunch spot. They have a decent amount of choices for their breakfast options. Their fried chicken eggs Benedict was amazing. The staff was very prompt any attentive at all times. The only downside is it is tucked away in a corner and hard to see while driving by. After finding it for the first time I will definitely return.

VFBw-ImYSwsoL2ZjurEG9A.text: We had party of 5 and all of us didn't really care for their breakfast. It was ok. Wasn't good nor bad, but the mimosa was good with fresh squeezed orange juice though.  The flour mixture used for waffles was um ...not that good, still can taste flour in the waffles. Egg Benedict, mediocre. It was overcooked and bun on bottom is cheap hard bread. Will not return.

J7KnY18O2m3ILh6uV0Elkw.text: So, my GF and I were heading to greens and protein and we saw this place and wanted to try it out. We were so GLAD we did, I had the Patty Melt and she ordered carnitas both were delicious and the service was world class wonderful! The portions were so large we got two full meals out of them and we switched entrees so I can say with 100% confidence they were both some of the best food out we ever had! Everyone should go here!

M4r7Ed3dHmiYxurhzyvNAQ.text: Great place the food was great and the service was even better. I love how there is so much food given you really get your monies worth at this place

naOTbLCsPfONfOB3jlq_tw.text: They delivered to us ,  we got breakfast.  Did not like the biscuit and gravy but corn beef hash was ok and eggs and bacon ok.  Pancakes were Hugh and good. Hash browns were not good.   Just ok place

9n8DSKiftB5qcPAdeMPW-g.text: Cant say enough good things about this place! Have been there for breakfast several times, and never walked away less than 100% satisfied! Lunch was just as good, too. If you haven't tried the the sausage & biscuits with gravy, you are missing out big time! They add fresh rosemary to the gravy, and it is perfect!  The service is always top notch as well. This is the kind of local gem you search for; lucky us it is right down the street!

ukA163Rc_YLWHTFU8GNq_A.text: We love to find and support mom and pop restaurants.  this place is great. the seats need help (did they get them second hand?) but the servings make up for it.  and maybe that's it.  someone ate their full meal... and then sat back down!  OOOOPH.  anyways i ordered the "short" stack.  so they may not be tall, but they flop over the plate!!  hubby looked across the table and said "you really aren't going to eat all that, are you??" his meal wasn't any smaller.  he ordered the flank steak.  It filled him for the rest of the day.    A group came in hoping for mimosas and were disappointed they are not yet available. I was looking for coffee and their cups are enourmous and the coffee delicious.    I love that this place is being run by those who own it.  Wish them all success!

uHqMNAS9O2ey6vxVmuoyfg.text: Great customer service followed by a great breakfast. Glad we stumbled upon this one!

jEIVARAqGff7NgzYLSNKTQ.text: This is my favorite breakfast place!!! I'm from Cali and was looking for a breakfast place for my 21st and they showed so much love. Going back tomorrow

opk6vZP2oAmggoHzu3K6Ew.text: The pancakes here are better than Vegas Famous Du-Par's! You can taste that a real pro is in the kitchen. Our hats off to the chef!   I was skeptical at first (I've tried my fair share of pancakes in town) but the moment I tasted a sweet bite of crispy, fluffy heaven I was sold! Perfectly crisp, extremely moist, fluffy and not swimming in butter; it's the perfect recipe! (besides our homemade pancakes)   The short stack comes with 2 massive pancakes for only $7 (Rated: 5/5.) That's a great value and could probably feed 3 adults if y'all into sharing and that wild stuff.   We also ordered the crab, prawn and avocado Benedict $14 (Rated: 4/5), which also comes with your choice of hash browns or potatoes. The portion is also larger than 2 adult appetites so we had a lot of leftovers (No one is complaining!) I loved the hollandaise sauce and the flavor of everything combined was great. The perfectly runny yolk and crisp edges of the english muffin were a tasty touch.  BYOB (BRING YOUR OWN BOOZE!) They have been open for 8 months now and still don't have their liquor license yet. I was looking forward to trying their advertised mimosas but was turned down.  Once they get the mimosas show on the road, I'll definitely try it out to see if my 4 stars can be pushed to 5!

8n7YTt4aZPdF0QUIcWxkGg.text: This place is bomb.com! Had the Chili Verde Omelet, and WOW what an amazing taste it had. It even gave Coffee Cup in Boulder City a run for its money! The ham and eggs were also amazing here. The pancakes were some of the biggest pancakes i've seen and they were also delicious. Mimosoas: had the mango, strawberry, lychee and peach. Lychee was my personal favorite. Mind you, these mimosas are strong as hell and will mess you up lol. Service: 10/10! They were always attentive and the cook obviously takes pride in her skills (i.e. she comes out and asks "how's my cooking?"). She is an AMAZING breakfast cook for sure! They even gave me and my girl a free tequila shot at the end of our session! These folks know how to make you feel at home for sure. Overall: 5 star experience, check em out!

1uMgD06B-LxmuzWQUs5ncw.text: This is another one of those simple pleasures that is "tucked away", not easy to find, but well worth the effort to discover it.   Simply stated; It is very good. Quality ingredients, well prepared food, and lots of it! No matter what you order, you'll enjoy the taste and you won't walk away hungry. You can't lose eating here. The name "Mimosas" is misleading, but "what's in a name?"  For my first experience, I enjoyed a Corned Beef Hash Skillet. There was no sign of that dynamic dual that usually appears on a restaurant Corned Beef Dinner. Both Hormel and Dinty Moore, were not there. Instead it was a well prepared brisket, done up right, and served with two eggs, over easy, and a huge portion of cottage potatoes. Very good.  This is a place that I will take my sons to for lunch. The menu is deverse as it is good, and those two hungry Neanderthals will enjoy a meal that will satisfy them for the day.   Okay, Mr. Jack, why not break down and give them a 5?    Because they are only open for Breakfast and Lunch. Do go there, before you drive out and wait in an hour long line for Cracker Barrel. This place is much better, and more reasonably priced.

CVJHRphPnddMwDW0ZqKLvg.text: Everyone is nice and friendly!food is delicious and the mimosas are to die for! I had the mango mimosa and it was tasty. Food is served in big portions as well!

FE8PZi0NuRwJ3GgU8BShMg.text: Absolutely delicious! Portions we're a good size, price was reasonable and the food was tasty. I and the steak omelette and pancakes. The pancakes we're huge! Will definitely go back.

rH8HMiU5S3AL-Ww_HNYyaw.text: Food was really good and the staff was extremely polite and friendly. We will definitely be coming back. I had the Breakfast Burrito and added steak to it. It was great and portions were very filling. My wife tried the Nutella Smore French Toast. It's very sweet but very tasty. No calorie counting here.

uuW3TaqOse72V9dTjcVi9g.text: Food was incredibly good. My roommate tried their lychee mimosa and he loved it. Staff was very friendly and it is a very family-oriented place... that serves alcohol hahah

Q08pZ5eQTDZwlKCCSxFrCQ.text: Cute place.  Have a variety of mimosas!  They have a large breakfast menu.  They also had micheladas that I will definitely go back to try!  As far as food goes it's what you'd expect for the price you're paying.  The Crab Benny was delicious.  Staff was friendly.

I6qE_ByvRFtupp5P6GAHkQ.text: Awesome!!  Huge portions, fabulous food, amazing mimosas, stellar customer service!  Absolutely worth the trip off the strip and will be our new "go-to" spot for breakfast.  The nutella waffle was amazing. It comes with a side of delicious syrup, although entirely unnecessary as the nutella is enough for flavor and the sweetness (that didn't stop me from dipping a few bites into the sticky goodness).  The chicken fried Benedict is perfection (go with the half and half- gravy/hollandaise sauce, but the hollandaise is perhaps my favorite ever, and I'm a slight snob about the stuff ;) ) The mimosas are worthy of the name for the restaurant.  Large and worth the $8.50 price tag.  We had the prickly pear, pomegranate, watermelon, and mango.  All were fantastic, but the latter 2 were our favorites (mango being the winner).  The staff was phenomenal!  Checked back often enough to be awesome, but not so much that they were over the top.  Friendly, cheerful, and attentive.  Just go.  Trust the reviews, it's worth the drive - although an uber isn't a bad idea if you'll have more than one mimosa!

2FuSBio9Hr9-io2_v9x40g.text: Ate here for the 1st time with my man.  What caught my eye on Yelp to try it here was the different flavor juice for the mimosa.   We tried out the guava and mango and loved it!  We had the shrimp and crab omelet which I loved while my man had the huevos rancheros.  Service was great and friendly.  Definitely returning to try out more mimosa's and the michelada

_St9E-7oSTHW9OH5gD3EAQ.text: This was a nice find! I had the chili verde and eggs, it was very good! The beans were exceptional! My friend had the fried chicken benedict and enjoyed it! The service was pretty good also! Finally, the guava mimosas are a must have!

E_MicPBdLNAlY0gocKrlPg.text: We randomly picked this place while on vacation from seattle. This is a family owned restaurant who makes almost everything in house. Oranges are freshly squeezed there, salsa is made in house. The whole crew feels like a family, and truly is passionate about what they do. We went for breakfast and it was really good, but not just the food; the whole atmosphere was amazing. We would rent a car next time just to go back.

ccZadN9wzXh59v8tZ-XVZg.text: I can't even begin to tell you how great this place is. The staff is absolutely amazing!!! We were a party of 16 - 18 and they accommodated us quickly as it is a small venue. While we waited there was ice cold water :). They checked in with us every few minutes letting us know they were getting our tables together. We sat down and immediately brought us water and took our orders promptly. Super friendly server. Not only does your server take care of you but everyone else in the restaurant plus the owner comes by and makes sure you are good. The super giant mimosas were great! The food... Oh man... AMAZING!!! We all tried one another plates and each of them was sooooo great from Breakfast to lunch order. Potatoes are the most amazing things I've ever had.  Th staff made everything so much fun as they got involved with getting our party rowdy with hats and pots and pans congratulating the newly weds in our party.   If you want BOMB ASS food and an amazing time with amazing service then you should get your Butt down here! Worth 15 min drive from the strip.

1XFpn7bHZ9zUlJZc9vTGdQ.text: We drove from North Las Vegas to give this place a try. Very impressed the minute we walked in. The staff was on it 100% of the way. Once you take the 20 minutes to read the menu be prepared for some hard decisions because everything sounds amazing.  The food presentation and taste was outstanding. We had Bananas Foster French Toast, Banana Walnut Pancakes, Smoked Salmon Skillet and Bacon Avocado Omelette.  Just four of us ate but we had good for six!   The servings sizes were huge and the food was bursting with flavor.  Can't wait to be back!!

Qm_kLLilyOlCL-kO7QTrew.text: Highly suggest this spot! GREAT SERVICE AND FOOD!!!! We got chilaquiles and a super torta and was finger lickin good! I definitely will be back!

kViPzy5W7eq0CbLyC_Mbsg.text: I would not recommend coming here. Me and a friend came to try out the super mimosas and get breakfast. First of all, the server didn't even bother to introduce herself or give any information regarding the menu or drinks. She was extremely rude and mocked us because we didn't know how to drink the super mimosas which are extremely hard to drink because they continuously spill on to the table. You would be better off getting the individual mimosas IF you want to come here. After we ordered, the waitress did not come back to our table once. The busser is the only person who actually bothered to check on us. When it came time to pay, the waitress sent another waitress to come and drop off the bill. We payed half cash and half on card, which should be simple enough. However, when the waitress grabbed the bill off of our table, she accidentally dropped the card on her way back to charge the bill. She came back to the table and told us we were short on the cash for our bill. We let her know that we put cash and card in the server book and she proceeded to tell us that there was nothing there and that we're short. We then got angry and asked if maybe she dropped the card because we were 100% sure we put it in with the cash. She didn't even bother to look for it and said she didn't drop it. One minute later after looking, we found it on the floor. So she did in fact drop it and didn't even bother to help. She didn't even care or offer an apology after we found the card on the floor. Horrible service and waitresses. The place has cobwebs in the corners of the windows which we noticed prior to anything happening. The food was decent, but until they learn to give proper service, don't waste your time.

g91IkxApf82a_TBIrN5hcQ.text: Came on Sunday morning, service and food was amazing! I got the fried chicken Benedict and my husband got the chicken bacon waffle. We both got mimosas and they were delicious and a decent size. Our server was super helpful and attentive. This will definitely be our new breakfast spot.

r2fpbpOC11ejysMQwEsYzw.text: Tried this place because of the high reviews. It definitely held up to the reviews. The food was amazing and the service was awesome. I had the California Benedict. Every bite was as good as the first. I ate my entire plate!  I will be back the next time I am in town.

ULHDSMD0Ea8405kn8ab1Jg.text: This is my new favorite breakfast place. We went here because we had a Groupon, we'll be back wven if we don't. The place is cute and open. The servers are super friendly and helpful. I ordered the bananas foster french toast. It was delicious - warm and gooey, grilled bananas on the side, whipped cream, ice cream, caramel, and toasted walnuts on top. My guy ordered the chicken fried benedict. It had well nade biscuits,  fried chicken, bacon, and country gravy piled on Benedict style, and it came with a side of hash browns. Both dishes were immense and delicious. We saw other dishes being served around us and they looked equally yummy.  *If you check in with Yelp they give you a free drink. It says coffee or soda, but they let me get a hot chocolate.  ** This place will be even more awesome when they get their liquor license and can serve thwir namesake mimosas.

JuHLS4fXMZlpM6qB2nLQYQ.text: Finally a breakfast that doesn't taste like every other place! Everything was obviously prepared there (no pre-packaged food here)! The spices they added were superb! I had the Breakfast Burrito and my wife had the Castro Benedict (artichoke and spinach). The mimosas were delicious! I definitely would recommend this restaurant if you're tired of the same old thing that every breakfast place serves! I can't wait to come back to try something else!!!

ZVls9hsxsQxx0OpJE9lKqg.text: Went here for breakfast on a Sunday morning. My husband had a omelette and I had blueberry pancakes. Al I can say is awesome, the food, service atmosphere.

UNJZIFvxIbH35bjtHZ4xXw.text: Very cute lil restaurant! It was our first time there and although it was pretty busy, we were seated almost right away. They have really fun-looking giant shared mimosas in dif flavors along w other mixed drinks. The breakfast menu is extensive including standard American  options, Mexican choices and even sweet treats like flavored pancakes and French toast.  Someone celebrated a birthday and amongst the busy-ness, several of the wait staff made a huge fun raucous for her including a song & a sombrero.  The staff was running around a bit frantically, but I have to praise our server Manuel. He was patient as we changed our minds on orders, noted all of our substitutions properly, and was very knowledgeable about the menu. Also he was friendly and alert despite how busy he was. The homemade corned beef hash, basic breakfast, and protein scramble were all very tasty. The only reason I didn't give this  place 5 stars, is that one of the young female table runners forgot 2 parts of my mom's dish, and seemed annoyed when we asked her to bring the sides we were entitled to and had ordered.  Other than that, I highly recommend this place and if possible, request Manuel!

-wR0i7wmGr50B3AKER4qcQ.text: I woke up feeling sick today, but I was hungry and craving some eggs Benedict. It was my first time ordering from Mimosas Gourmet. It was amazing! So tasty! And it came pretty quick too!  Next weekend, hopefully I'll be over this sickness so I can actually go there and enjoy some mimosas

vSmjxmM3uMtsPEr0ZFcllw.text: This is probably my favorite breakfast place in town.  The food is absolutely amazing and reasonably priced. The menu is easy to pick from with plenty of options. Starting off with basic breakfast, skillets, scrambles, Benedict's, waffles, omelette, french toast, pancakes, specialties like chille verde, breakfast burrito... the list goes on but it is such an easy pick.   Service was very prompt and waiter( Alex) was very personable as well as helpful. To be honest Everyone that works here has a very good team chemistry. Great way to give customer service.   On to the mimosa and Michelada...  ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC!!!   So let me tell you about a drink that almost had me ask for a bed because I was full and lit lol   They have this really big mimosa that I had to stand up to drink. Granted I'm 5'3 but still. They call it "super mimosa"  literally the biggest goblet I have ever seen. It has fresh pineapple juice, a bottle of champagne and some syrup to add flavor, by the time me and my friend left this place, not only were we full but we were lit ! Lol   I recommend the "super mimosa" specially if it's a party of 3+.   Absolutely amazing !

oMaBEiZagoax1dXJSo9SFA.text: WOW, words can't express how good and satisfying this place is!!!.   SERVICE was quick,  attentive throughout and just overall great.  Everyone was so nice and accommodating and well informed. Made you feel like you were at your Tias house!  FOOD was BOMB!!! ordered the chilaquiles anos chile verde. Both were just like your abuela would make.  The chilaquiles were made with chile rojo and chorizo. Crema anos queso fresco on top and 2 eggs made your way underneath or on top as I got them. Must get the country potatoes  they are SOOOO GOOD!!!!!  my meal was so good and authentic would go back again and again.  Hubby ordered chile verde,  which comes with beans, 2 eggs your way and choice of hash browns or potatoes and tortillas. This was also BOMB!! Servings size are just right, at best prices!!  DRINKS of course we had mimosas! You can mix two flavors for the same price,  so I had prickly part and lychee which was just the right amount of sweet (not overly sweet), my hubby got mango and kiwi,  which he said was sweet and sour probably not the best mix,  lol but he drank it. They were more than happy to change it for him but he decided to just finish it. I swear these drinks were 2 mimosas in one,  they were big!   This place is a MUST try if you haven't already,  seriously come here and try you won't regret it, great start to my day!!!

SUQJ21NCgndyL7ZOUpjKTw.text: Looks tasty unfortunately for me I did not like the taste of my corned beef hash.  I was in between the corn beef hash and the chilaquiles and the waiter had said both of those are their top sellers so I went with the corned beef hash.  Yes their portions are huge and the plating was nice. My plate came with country potatoes on the bottom topped with not so tender corned beef and on top of that two eggs drizzled with a horseradish sauce. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the drizzle of horseradish was actually pleasantly good but the rest just had that off-putting taste of grease. It also was accompanied by a biscuit but it was more of a dense dinner roll and some recycled looking orange wedge to finish the presentation.  Just not great at all.  Service was okay, a little rushed. I think the oversized party looking mimosas is what brings people here.

PE2l8dX5b7YUOmD1Xm03jA.text: Have been to this place several times.  This was our first visit on the weekend.    We decided that a Saturday afternoon brunch would be a good idea.  Knowing that it would be crowded.    We arrived and were seated pretty quick.  We each ordered fairly quick.  The music was really loud this visit.  We could hardly hear each other across the table.    Our waiter was good at getting us drinks.  It was really hard to hear the waiter and the waiter to hear us.  This may have contributed to several problems with the order.  The food was ok. As always the skillet was great.  Several mistakes on my sons plate and my wife's.  Their plates didn't come out as ordered.  No cheese on the hash browns and to much gravy on chicken fried steak .    The waiter was informed when he return and the chicken fried steak issue was fixed.  The brought out a new side of hash browns.  They weren't cooked well and had two slices of unmelted kraft singles on top.  The manager said they were having problems in the kitchen and offered us a free dessert.  We declined because we were full.  I would have expected a slight adjustment off the 48.00 blll, but the waiter said for us not to tip him because of the service.  Maybe 5.00 off the bill would have been ok.   We did leave a smaller tip than usual, but we walked away with a sour taste that the business that made errors in the kitchen would expect the waiter to not get tipped instead of a couple dollars off the bill.    Truly a little surprised. I have always enjoyed this place, never had a problem, but my visits were during the week in the past.  I will return to this place, because we all have bad days.    I just suggest that waiters not take the hit for the business.  If the service was bad I would agree.  It was clearly the kitchen today.  So live and learn.

dz0GccQ7i6Flvuhkx2P4XA.text: First off, the service. My drink never once was empty, plenty of napkins and condiments without even asking for anything.  The outside of the venue isn't the nicest area, but inside the restaurant is a lot better and relaxed.   THE FOOD. My friend and I had the chilaquiles, which had chorizo and red sauce. The potatoes were red and cooked to perfection... all topped with quesco fresco, YUM. It was the best chilaquiles ever hands down.   On top of the great food, once again the service. They treated us with the Churro waffle and it was soooooooo good! True hospitality is hard to find, but these guys specialize in it. I will be coming back the next time I'm in Vegas! THANK YOU.

brK5d4qviEL_eeCPY_Ul-A.text: Food was OK, at best. I got the prickly pear mimosa (brut champ mixed with fruit puree). It was... fine. No ice, so the drunk was room temp. Came here when it was 110 degrees out and I'm not sure if their AC was out or what but it was so hot in there. I didn't even finish my food, rushed to pay and ended up leaving because I couldn't take how warm it was getting in there. Probably won't come back, and wouldn't recommend that you go during the hot summer months.

IyLPvAaw3brXkjaz3oExog.text: Came here while on vacation. It wasn't that busy due to it being a week day. I ordered a mimosa. For some reason, it came out too quickly as if it had been sitting in the refrigerator. I didn't really like that. However, the mimosa had some strength to it. We had a good server. We also ordered the PANCAKES. I am not a pancake person, BUT these pancakes here! LIFE CHANGING. They are huge, fluffy, and cooked thoroughly. IHOP who??? These pancakes were one of the highlights of my trip. I can't even explain to you how good they were. 10/10.

tZEIZNeVPK1Lb-XuJXEO6Q.text: Stopped by at about 11 on Sunday for brunch. The wait wasn't terrible for two people. I ordered the chilaquiles which were great, and my husband had the corned beef skillet and his was really good too. He had the unlimited mimosas which were the right amount of strong and tasted great. The service was great for how busy it was! We will be back and plan to bring family when they visit.

nt-MlUB-hmWPlBVaxLPB4Q.text: My boyfriend and I tried this place out for brunch while on vacation. While the service was great, the food was not what I expected. The reviews and pictures lured me in. I had a prickly pear mimosa which I did enjoy and they give you a full glass. We both got the waffle bacon and chicken. I assumed the chicken would be wings but it was chicken tenders and they were not my idea of fried. The waffle wasn't bad but I've had better. If your decide to try it, don't be surprised if your expectation doesn't meet the experience

pNwiLD2bA3291usd1i3aJQ.text: Short and sweet, this restaurant must have the worst owner/management I have ever experienced. I also can only assume they have management as there was clearly none visible on July 4th 2019.

JMigVO9PQQgtxxhDzLhjJw.text: Try there waffles.   I ordered their chicken and bacon waffles.   Got it without the bacon as I asked.  Eggo's taste much better then their bland bread that they call waffles.   Maybe they NEED the bacon as flavor?  And what's with these careless places dumping powdered sugar all over the chicken and barely leaving any on the flavorless waffles that needs the sugar?  Chicken strips, country fried steak, biscuits and gravy.   All eh.   Nothing special.  Not good, not bad since we were hungry.     The guava mimosa was really good.    Service felt rushed.  We were ready to order and server wasn't sure whether to take our order or take the order from some other guests.   I can only assume since they were there first that our server expected us to order drinks, than wait until she takes someone else's order and then come back to us to take our food order.   I came to that assumption because we told her we were ready to order and she kept looking at the other table as if she had to be there.

sgQna_jtfJatJJfRXZnnZg.text: It was Mother's Day and my man took me to Brunch! The food was good I had the French toast combo. It came with 2 scrambled eggs 2 French toast and bacon (turkey bacon for me). The establishment was so small and busy, people were literally waiting in line outside. Not to mention it was 100 degrees inside. On top of it being Mother's Day It was my man's birthday they brought shots and made him wear a Sombrero while they sang happy birthday to him, it was great! I came for the mimosas, which were served in a margarita glass instead of a champagne glass, with no ice. Needless to say I was a little disappointed. Nonetheless, I will be back to experience this establishment again, this time on a regular day to get an authentic experience.

NVqYcW1Z5O7f5oSJXRRw8Q.text: I decided my boyfriend & I should have breakfast here after checking out Yelp for the more popular places close by. Although I can't drink because I'm pregnant, I thought it would be a hit still since the food looked so good.   After arriving I was pleased be immediately seated & the restaurant wasn't too busy at all for a Friday. I originally wanted to go to a favorite breakfast/brunch spot that has recently closed to get one of the best chorizo Benedict's I've ever had, but decided to opt for the one here instead. I had only water that was immediately brought to the table & my boyfriend ordered a lemonade. I don't think the server appreciated that I only wanted water.   We ordered & a little while after our food came out. My boyfriend ordered chilaquiles which he really enjoyed. I asked for my hash browns to be well done/crispy because I know how sometimes in a hurry things are prepared fast, but they looked like they were barely browned but only on one side with the center undercooked. Truly my plate looked a mess. I do understand when you order eggs Benedict it isn't always the prettiest, however it just looked thrown together. There was barely any chorizo & smothered with so much hollandaise my muffin was soggy first bite. I truly didn't want to complain because I was so hungry, but my boyfriend looked so disgusted.   All in all, I will be sure to try something different if I do ever visit again. After getting home, I realized that there wasn't even any avocado on my Benedict that CAME with my meal, which was even more disappointing. For the place to not have been busy at all I thought there could've been more effort put into my dish.

vzV6dXycMd0DbcNyb-DibQ.text: Fabulous service, ENORMOUS portions, potent adult beverages, and, delicious food!!  Our son had the bananas foster French toast, holy cow!  Sugar overload in a delicious in manner; I had the chorizo Benedict, excellent!  Our daughter had the corned beef hash, clearly homemade; out of this world!  Highly recommend you give this place a try!!

Uf6D1GlLzS7cGBbP2uIfQQ.text: The rating is 4.5. Met my friend for Sunday brunch at 9:30am and seated immediately.  They have their liquor license now so Bloody Mary time! The menu is loaded with lots of delicious items, the full breakfast fare plus burgers, sandwiches, and salads. We went with the smoked salmon benedict and the fried chicken benedict.   Both were delicious. Fried chicken benedict was tasty, the sausage gravy very mild so add your own pepper. I enjoyed the smoked salmon as well, maybe more cream cheese. Hollandaise sauce was nice and light, not clumpy or heavy. I would have liked a slice of lemon to add some citrus to it.   I heard the pancakes were great, and the plates that passed by would confirm that. I will be back again to try those.   Overall, I liked the food and presentation very much. Service was on point. Price was fair at under $50 for two plus Bloody Marys. I will return.

YTKcgJZr7d3ygH7oKTx7_w.text: This place is extraordinary. I was searching for a place that had bottomless mimosa's during the week, and stumbled across this place. That being said, they do NOT have bottomless mimosa's, however, they do have about 10 different flavors. My wife loves mimosa's so we drove over a half hour to this place because... Mimosa's. It was worth every mile, as this was a gem. For food, she had the smoked salmon Benedict, and I had the Irish Benedict. Believe me when I tell you, the corned beef was NOT from a can. She said hers was incredible, but I didn't try it as I'm not a fan of salmon.  She tried two different types of mimosa's, the Peach, and prickly pear. She preferred the prickly pear (it was incredible) but seriously loved them both.   I honestly don't have anything bad to say about this place. We will be going back on a regular basis, even if it is clear across town. If ONLY they'd open one on the east side, or downtown

GVAGaSoSqC2tJpvw9QOKQA.text: I hate saying "go here" because it feels like an undiscovered gem.  But if no one goes it may dissappear. It is good enough I'll take a line over that so "go". Great Mexican breakfast and potatoes to die for (and as an Irish descendent I know potatoes).

q0aVKQGyCs3wJv1ojQM2pw.text: Just an update on my latest visit to this phenomenal restaurant. It was extremely crowded today however we were seated rather quickly. I also had a pancake which was the size of the plate!  My son had the Cinnamon French Toast and that was very tasty as well.  Huge thanks and shout out to Carlos and the others that provided excellent service.

aRG1EYx1Sb3GwssZ2nNXxw.text: Their food has a good taste but the proportions of some dishes are skimpy. 4s8yMYtJs7ZhctOUYKOVeA.text: There's no better news than hearing that Mimosas Gourmet can finally serve mimosas!! Although I came for the Sunday brunch mimosa, I stayed for the Nutella waffle combo. It's a homemade waffle with Nutella, strawberries, bananas, and whipped cream. If you're not a huge fan of sweets then you can also opt for their skillets, benedicts, or sandwiches. All of the pancakes, French toasts, and waffles have the option of turning it into combo which includes bacon, sausage or ham with two eggs of your choice. The restaurant isn't too big, so to save yourself the wait for a table it's best to get there before 10 or after 1 on the weekends. The service was also very friendly and there wasn't too long of a wait for breakfast. I'd definitely like to come back again.

nLYgMO_YRh0J5-wbJpC8tA.text: It was amazing! I ordered a passion fruit mimosa and the California omelette with potatoes. Food was great and the portion was more than I can handle. Recommend!!

i0KLkO0eLyJN8vJc6u3GGw.text: Loved this little place!  In a very unassuming strip mall way in the back but so worth the effort finding it! I really enjoyed my visit and will absolutely be back!

3yhDvuXuiy2-u2yeza2wDw.text: Where do I begin..came here today with my family of 7..we were seated immediately..the food was AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Alex and the entire waiters made sure we were all accommodated and felt welcomed! This was the best decision ever to come here! Thank you! Oh and the drinks..fucking amazing!!!

TXoqPK9shjg__hlA3CSyAA.text: Good food in big portions.  Environment: The exterior of the restaurant is a little bit underwhelming, with the restaurant being in the middle of a strip mall and with a lackluster banner. Upon entering, the inside is open, however I would not say it is much more impressive than the outside. I think it could use a different color scheme or maybe some more decorating.   Food: The food was good, and the portions were very generous. I ordered the Mexican skillet which came with potatoes mushrooms, avocado, sausage, and salsa. All the flavors went together well and it was very filling. Additionally, it was served which a biscuit which was HUGE. A point I did find interesting is that upon looking at the drink section of the menu it had stated that they did not have their liquor license so they were unable to serve any alcohol, which seemed a little contradictory since the restaurant has the word mimosa in the name yet we were unable to order one. Despite this the list did look extensive so once they do get their license I would be more than happy to try two or three of them haha.  Overall I don't know if I will come here again any time soon due to the location but if you are in the area and are looking for a nice breakfast spot I would recommend trying this place out

The bacon waffle with honey dipped chicken tenders was unique and flavorful. We will be back soon!

VTTwhisqiQVFEGj8uLgS2w.text: Yes they have Mimosa's in their name but don't  assume you can get one! Not sure how or why or how long its been but Mimosa's Gourmet didn't have their liquor license when we visited them, I didn't care but my hubby would've liked to have a beer. We were sat right away, the dining room was full on a Sunday morning.  Doug got the Meat Lovers Skillet, he said it was good but seemed to be lacking the amount of meat a Meat Lovers Skillet should have. I got the Huevos Rancheros with hashbrowns, it was really delicious! The portion was large. I would get it again. The place was clean. The wait staff was pleasant, although we could've used a bit more attention, I feel they were a bit understaffed for such a busy time.

5keNXyxFYKysjdin_lU_7Q.text: I recommend this place ! Very good restaurant ! The food is delicious (homemade biscuit so so good :-) ), the staff is very nice and friendly :-) Large opening hours 6:00 am to 3:00 pm everydays, parking, large food choice for everyone.  Thank you so much to the staff ;-) Let's go everybody :-)

yFurIPfvAGfs6BBDxj032g.text: Service, food, alcohol, and inside environment all incredibly delicious and beautiful!! If you haven't been, definitely go and try it out. FYI: The portion sizes are large. Very Large.

b-nsCiVc_JRRuL-KEDQBJw.text: Came here to nurse a hangover from last night, and the place could not have been more perfect. Food was very authentic, and potatoes tasted like my mom's home cooking. Portions here are huge, I will probably eat these leftovers for two more days haha. Our bartender/server, I think his name is Alex, was very attentive and came to check on us several times. We have ordered a michelada and a Bloody Mary, and the drinks were good and strong. Very impressed with this place, and I would definitely come back. Suggestion: if you are not a big eater, split your entree with someone.

LTPLFWitqNQCYtWsz7KISQ.text: I love this place!! My family and I go here very often. The food is delicious. The staff is extremely friendly and the place is clean. I love that they have other options if you don't eat pork like myself.

ktl-FNaTc3gcL97VFT97gw.text: Absolutely loved this breakfast spot. Huge portions, tasty food, outstanding service. The pancakes are gigantic!! Even the white toast is perfection. Can't wait to come with friends so I can order the giant mimosa! In the meantime, I ordered a peach mimosa (is that just a Bellini?!) and it was presented nicely in a little garnished goblet of its own.

fUqCXhSdr2sJ_34xAmE6kw.text: This place is great , fast friendly service. Fun atmosphere. Yummy food . I always have coffee and my girl always gets mimosas . Yummy French toast , skillets , Benedict's . 5 star all around and I don't say this lightly

c-5rRAotoLMmCkPso478HQ.text: Huge portions here. Love it. Would recommend for you to eat here if you are really hungry. Service is amazing, fast and friendly

9YGHSLIftvx8Vvw466V4Vg.text: Man.... I really wanted to love this place. But here's the run down:  -1 the mimosas are premade.... I asked her not not put so much juice in it and she said that she couldn't because it was premade. Got it and the champagne was flat.   -1 the food was premade.... I asked her to not put jalapenos on my dish and she said that she couldn't because it was premade.   -1 were my hashbrowns premade too? They were perfectly square and the center inside of my hashbrowns were mushy.... like it was premade, frozen, and then reheated.   -1 why was my bill $50 if everything was premade? I ordered 2 dishes and 2 mimosas....  I really wanted to love this place

9QWRIL1JCalMVovumAkvag.text: I'll admit that most of my 2-Star review is based on the owner/manager not accepting my Groupon that was for 4 people (we had a party of 3).  We spent well over the Groupon amount and I thought, like my other favorite sit-downs (Egg Works in Summerlin and Shabu Shabu on Sahara), this place would honor the Groupon, especially that we had spent at least $40 over the Groupon amount.  To top it off, owner/manager was pretty rude about it by saying bluntly "should've read the fine print"... I know, petty.  But you're in the business of customer service!  Wife is an Egg Benedict's connoisseur and she wasn't impressed with their plate.  Again, she actually prefers the more country style version at Egg Works.  I went safe with Eggs and Bacon and fortunately, they didn't mess that up. I don't recall what the third person got but I don't remember her being impressed.  The mimosas were tasty, but at their price point in relation to service quality, food quality, and interior space and design, I'd rather pay double for a better experience on The Strip.  I'm interested in seeing what type champagne they use.  Either way, you can make them yourself with your own quality bottle along with your choice of Sunkist, Tropicana or Minute Maid... OR, WAIT FOR IT... SIMPLY ORANGE!!!  Yeah, not impressed with this place.  You guys saved $30 from not honoring a semi-valid :) Groupon but lost an avid wannabe Elite Yelper for life!!!

SIcDWwFZo6yKGrVx6ieOmQ.text: The food here is super good and the staff is very friendly and on top of it!! Had a wonderful time and the atmosphere is great! Their pancakes are superb and their French toast are by far some of the best I've had!! We are definitely coming back!

8MeGAu00pMS44dw6GM9PIw.text: I'm typically not the review writing type, but this place deserves it! I'm from out of town, and was in the area taking my fur baby to the specialty vet. I was poking around on here looking for some breakfast, and thought this place sounded decent. Boy was I wrong! This place is freaking LEGIT! The food is so, so, SO YUMMY! I had the best corned beef hash I have ever had in my 24 years on this earth. The mimosas are really good too! You cannot go wrong with this restaurant. Do yourself a favor, and come get breakfast here. Trust me, you WILL NOT be disappointed. I have come here after dropping my pupper off at the vet several times, and have received the same great food and service each time.

PFRIejnoyn3RuVuccNzQVg.text: Ahhh..Brunch..one of the best things about waking up semi early. Brunch and Mimosas go together like, peanut butter and jelly, cereal and milk, ham and burger. This place though..didn't have the mimosas yet. Now i know what you're thinking, "how on earth did this girl enjoy brunch with no liquor?!" But trust me..they got 5 stars for a reason! The food!!! Oh.My. Goodness...is it legal to have biscuits that big? Like, what giant created those? Why is this pancake so dang good?! Why is my skillet this amazing? Seriously, They'll have their liquor license soon, so they will be my PB&J. I want to see this business do good, my waitress was amazing! I forgot her name!! But I'll remember her face as i'm sure she will probably remember my party of 4. Such a sweetie, gave great suggestions and checked on us. This feels like a place where if you come enough, everyone will know your name. They were so good, that 5 days later, i ordered delivery! lol.

xxSdnR_3jV6b0djDJNk68Q.text: Came here for the first time on Mother's Day and they got us in really quick. The place is small but they are prompt with their service. I enjoyed the food, the only issue I had was that the potatoes tasted like they were heated over and over again. I will be coming in again to try their giant mimosa.

i_ACAFBPLLAvPLR-YzwVpQ.text: Excellent service and I liked my huevos rancheros. Crispy tortilla was something I haven't had before and I enjoyed it. Lots of seating and some TV's make it a casual place. Will go back again.

nMRCIx2q7_THsnLD5fXhhg.text: We ate here for the first time and loved it. Everyone at Mimosas was friendly. We were welcomed right away, seated quickly, and had drinks moments after that. Everyone can refill drinks which makes it impossible to ever have an empty glass or cup. The food was delicious from the Nutella French toast which is a mile high, to the homestyle potatoes with onions and peppers. At a time when food quality and customer service are questionable at most places, Mimosas was a wonderful surprise with great food, lots of it, and smiling, helpful staff. We'll definitely be back and recommend it to anyone looking for a great breakfast/brunch/lunch location.

BvIpfAf87MQRDt32zWneTg.text: Occupying the location formerly know as Pho Vietnam Grille Express off of Durango, behind Arby's, there's plenty to like on their menu. Always opting for sweeter options, my son and I split the churro waffle and nutella s'mores French toast. The former could have used more cinnamon and sugar, but was still a delicious waffle with a light and crispy texture and topped with a generous scoop of vanilla ice cream. The nutella s'mores French toast was pure sweetness overload. Three thick slices of egg soaked bread were coated in graham crackers with layers of nutella and marshmallows between each. It was so overwhelming that I could only finish a little more than half. A good concept, well executed dishes, and huge portions have turned me into a fan and most likely a repeat customer.
